32001.name: Quiz Taxi
32001.description: In this game you can replay the show Quiz Taxi where a well known tv host drives around in a taxi (he's the driver) and everybody who calls this certain taxi suddenly (and without them knowing)is a participant in a tv quiz show. The questions get asked on the way to the participant's original destination. If they fail, the taxi stops and they have to get out, if they don't fail more than three times (they have 2 jokers - a phone call and asking people on the street) and they get to their destination, they can either get the money or play at high risk to lose everything, or win twice as much.

32002.description:
In the multiplayer card-driven, city-building strategy game Forged in Steel, players take on the role of a prominent family in a burgeoning Colorado county in 1900 as turbulent social and technological changes are about to reshape the way all Americans live. Each family seeks to control one of four sectors (mining, industry, city, or commercial) while also striving to be Mayor to control the appointment of other players to offices.

The game takes place over three eras (turns/decades), each with multiple phases in which players are dealt eight cards — all with historic black-and-white photos from Colorado — and must discard one and bank two for their final turn. Cards are used to either play Municipal Muscle points to build, buy, or seize structures, or used for the "event" listed on every card. Cards can also be used to set yearly "Headlines" or "Themes" which evoke a movement in American society or technology and change VP awards or other variables in the game. Structures are scored by multiplying the amount the sector tracks have advanced by the number of buildings owned. Different tracks progress differently.

Finally, players can build parks, civic buildings, hospitals, and police stations. These buildings in turn affect further play and cause neighborhoods to have more political votes at turn's end, increase VPs for proximity, or protect against certain negative cards.

Forged in Steel is an organic building game in that all builds change the landscape and players may build only adjacent to where others have built "the grid/network". At turn's end, the game decides how many immigrants come seeking jobs based on how many factories and commercial buildings were built that turn. Too many? Unrest grows and there could be a riot, undermining all of your recent city-building efforts. The National Guard will step in to help you, of course, but they are usually outnumbered, and there's often fighting in the streets, so be wary of not contributing to the "Unrest Track".

Can your family negotiate the turbulent changes of the early 1900s and become the local political and economic powerhouse? From the New Deal, Women's Suffrage, City Beautiful and Spanish Flu, to sidewalks and paved streets, all aspects of a 1900s western American city are incorporated, and players will learn about the rise of those developments that changed cities, labor, industry, and society forever.
32002.name: Forged in Steel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 018 – I, Geek interviews Don Lloyd
The Game of Crowd Funding Wade Broadhead Interview 08-20-2014
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 11!

32004.name: Chaos
32004.description:
Chaos - "The fast-paced strategy game that's virtually unpredictable"

You never know what's going to happen in this easy to learn game of strategy. Take turns stacking discs on the 10"-square wooden board; any stack with four discs is redistributed in all four directions around it—often resulting in chaos! Includes 24 wooden discs. 2 players."

32005.description:
EMPIRES IN HARM is a strategic and diplomatic game for between seven to ten players (depending on the Campaign selected) that covers warfare in Europe during the 18th and early 19th centuries.

The military counters in the game generally represent Corps and Squadrons, with each army factor being equivalent to roughly 1000 to 3000 men and each “ship” equivalent to one ship of the line or a number of frigates & sloops.

Current version: 5.2
32005.name: Empires in Harm

32006.description:
This official extension has been published in the French magazine "Des jeux sur un plateau" issue 40.

This extension includes John McNeal winter pack (character sheet plus 4 new items), Eva Kramer winter pack (Character sheet plus 3 new items), Ksiaz castel pathfinding resume, Ksiaz crypt pathfinding resume and Tesla base pathfinding resume.
boardgameversion: Jeux sur un Plateau Magazine Edition
32006.name: Tannhäuser: Eva Kramer Winter Pack

32008.name: Maneuver Warrior
32008.description:
Modern combat in a variety of theaters. Uses same Warfighter rules system as The Guards and Movement to Contact.

Platoon-level combat uses step-loss damage system and 3 different combat tables (direct fire, assault combat, indirect fire). Scenarios written to resemble US Army operations orders. Modular geomorphic maps include both woodland and desert maps, varying urban/mountainous terrain.

Combat involves rolling dice based on unit's firepower value, subtracting target's armor, and looking up result on CRT - stun, flip, retreat, kill, no effect. All damage applied simultaneously, so 'killed' units get their final shots.

Recon units have separate objectives to acquire/locate targets of intel value.

Additional rules cover engineers (obstacles & fortifications), scouts (stealth movement & recon by fire), leaders (special battlefield effects), and compatible with civilians-on-the-battlefield rules from The Guards.

3 die-cut countersheets (56/sheet, large 7/8in counters), rules, 4 d/s maps, reference sheets for each set of units, scenarios (see below), blank scenario sheets, cardstock admin counters (non-cut), errata sheet with some counter corrections. US mechanized battalion compatible replacement for non-die-cut counters from Movement to Contact.

Units include:

US
Russian / Arab
Israeli
Arab Irregulars
Partisan Irregulars
Australian




5 scenarios in the box (others available online):

US v Iraqi irregulars
Arab v Israeli
Russian v Chechen
US v Balkan irregulars
Australian v Partisan irregulars




All scenarios written as paired sheets, so each player has their own instructions that are unknown to the opponent.

32009.name: Charlie McCarthy's Radio Party
32009.description:
"The game consists of 21 figures... one of Charlie McCarthy and four each of Edgar Bergen, Don Ameche, Dorothy Lamour, Nelson Eddy, and Robert Armbruster. Also a spinner which determines play."

The spinner features a picture of the puppet Charlie McCarthy.

32010.name: Get in the Scrap
32010.description:
This game has a very unique theme: collecting scrap metal for the war effort.

The board features four scrap collection centers, four iron foundries, and paths among them.

32011.name: Top Pacheeza
32011.description:
This game's board has a maze of colored squares. Players are attempting to go from one part of the board to another. The theme of the game is related to Native Americans.

On the box the game is Top Pacheeza, but on the board the game is Top Pacheesa.

32012.name: Fünf in einer Reihe
32012.description:
Hopsi the kangaroo is excited. It's about to go on holidays. The players help Hopsi to pack his bags.
The game consists of 5 quadratic boards each showing items that Hopsi may need for its holiday such as a toothbrush or bathing suit.
Four of the boards belong to the players, the fifth is the one where Hopsi moves around.
The youngest player rolls the dice and moves Hopsi from one up to three spaces. He is allowed to mark the space (item) that he lands on on his map with a red chip.
The first player who achieves marking a row of five spaces (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) wins the game.

32013.name: Weird U.S.: The Game
boardgameexpansion: Weird New Jersey: Weird U.S. Booster Pack
32013.description:
from the back of the box: "Have you ever wondered where the Weirdos gather? Welcome to Weird U.S., where colorful characters like the Melon Head, Skunk Ape, La Llorona, Bunnyman, Frogboy and the Killer Clown journey to not so far off places like Midgetville, Crybaby Bridge, Danvers State Hospital and the Land of 2093 Milk Jugs in their attempts to collect travelers and be the last Weirdo standing! Based on the stories from Weird U.S. by Mark Moran and Mark Sceurman. From Weird books come Weird games."

Players move around the board trying to gather travelers while dodging being exposed by Mark and Mark and battling the other Weirdos.

The game is rated Ages 8 and up.

32014.description: In the Celestial Empire of the Ming Dynasty the leading families vie with one another for political power and influence over the Imperial government. They do not compete by brazen force of arms, but within the confines of Confucian philosophy. Subtle influence is wielded, gifts are given and received, setting up a network of relationships that will lead one family to dominate the government under a benign Emperor. Players of Confucius participate in this discreet and delicate struggle for power. As well as influencing the three principal ministries of government, leadership of the great exploration and trading fleets will bring renown to the one who heads them, and glory attends the general leading invasions of foreign lands.
32014.name: Confucius

boardgamehonor: 2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Children's Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
32016.description:
It's a long distance go-kart race for the coveted Gumball Cup!

Players use numbers and colors to better position themselves in the race: higher numbers pass lower numbers and a color passes the same color if that kart is ahead of them. Play through two checkpoints then the finish line!

A very fast, fun game for the whole family - up to 8 players!
32016.name: Gumball Rally

32017.name: Murder à la carte: The Brie, the Bullet & the Black Cat
32017.description:
You have been invited to dinner at the Official Residence of the Deputy Mayor of Casablanca. The guest of honor was to have been France's greatest ever living mime artist - but he fails to appear...you've guessed it, he's been murdered...

Everyone is a suspect, but who is the murderer?

So who stars in this great adventure, obviously you, but you don't play yourself you take on the role of one of the following characters:

Hughes Le Grandebutte - Deputy Mayor of Casablanca The epitomy of solid respectability
Edith Le Grandebutte - his wife, former dancer Married to Hughes - but not altogether happy - still yearn for your former life as a dancer
Nicole Le Grandbutte - their daughter 18 yr old daughter of above - would rather be in Paris than Casablanca - does not approve of her father working with the Germans
Otto Von Pinkelwurst - a Gestapo Officer, fanatical and possible mad Doesn't understand why he is in Africa rather than a senior staff post in Berlin
Kirk Ransom III - an American who runs Kirk's African Cafe in downtown Casablanca late 30's, doomed romantic hero nursing a broken heart and a bottle of whiskey. Suave, elegant and slightly battered.
Countess Bogov - an exiled Russian aristocrat, glamorous and mysterious. Passionate anti-communist; sympathetic with Germans
Monsieur Oily-Carte - booking agent for the Moulin Bleu nightclub in Paris Educated in England, sophisticated with impeccable manners
Pierre Payanski - 24 year old half-Russian poet. Anti-fascist with a bad leg
Cherie Boot - French cabaret singer in mid 20's Husky voice, sultry, decadent & exotic, almost androgynous
Ingrid Pith - Danish art dealer - finds painting all over Europe. Busy and flirtatious

Optional Guests for 11-12 player game :
Seamus O'Hack - a dissolute Irish journalist more interested in drinking than writing
Pia Fedora - Spanish cabaret star and love of the Black Cat. Fiery, passionate and bereaved

32018.name: Hullabaloo: The Game of Observation
32018.description:
Hullabaloo the Game of Observation

Players wager on winning three rounds of observation activities using pictures of cluttered junk. In Eyespy the players look for items that the Game Boss has chosen. The first player to find each of the three objects wins double his wager. In Scrutiny the players look at a picture card for a minute and then answer questions that the Game Boss asks about the picture. In Detection the Game boss picks out an item and writes several clues for the other players to use to determine that object.

32019.name: Interplay
32019.description:
Interplay is a relatively simple abstract strategy game. Play is conducted with metal pegs on a wooden board. When placing a new peg, players place a peg 3 spaces away from the previously played one - either straight, diagonally, or in an L shape.

Players score points for every peg adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to the peg they place. A round ends when all 37 pegs are placed (or if, due to the gameplay, no further pegs can be placed).

32021.description:
Summoned from the depths of the Earth, the Elemental rolls across the landscape like an unstoppable tremor.

Everywhere he roams the earth quakes and he lays ruin upon friends and foes alike.

The Earth Elemental figure was a promotional miniature available at demo events and conventions, as well as from the Days of Wonder website. The package contains a Creature figure with its banner, 3 cards, and 1 Creature Lair hexagon. This miniature requires the BattleLore core game.

Contents:

1 Earth Elemental figure
1 banner
1 Landmark hex
2 Creature Summary cards
1 Landmark Summary card




Expands:

BattleLore
32021.name: BattleLore: Earth Elemental

32022.description:
Towering over the battlefield, the Hill Giant is a frightening sight to behold.

His hammer blows send terrifying shockwaves that shatter the best armor!

And that's before he even gets to his Rock Pile, from which no distant foe should feel safe!

The Hill Giant figure was a promotional miniature that was available with any BattleLore preorder placed at your local game store or at the Days of Wonder web store. The package contains a Creature figure with its banner, 3 cards, and 1 Creature Lair hexagon. This miniature requires the BattleLore core game.

Contents:

1 Hill Giant figure
1 banner
1 Landmark hex
2 Creature Summary cards
1 Landmark Summary card




Expands:

BattleLore
32022.name: BattleLore: Hill Giant

32025.description:
Einfach Genial Knobelspass (Ingenious Puzzles) is the next game in the Einfach Genial line.

In EGK, players place Ingenious dominoes to match the pattern on each play board. Through deduction and logic, players figure out where each domino belongs since no spaces can remain, all dominoes must fit on the board and there is only one unique combination for each one.

Each of the 1 to 4 players gets an identical set of 21 dominoes that have the same colored back and each player is given a board. Then you all race to solve the puzzles. Whoever solves his puzzle problem first wins.

There are five levels of puzzle, providing an opportunity for more and more challenging levels of competitive play. You can handicap more experienced or older players by having them play a higher level of board.

This is similar to Domino Knobelspass, which uses regular dominoes.
32025.name: Einfach Genial Knobelspass

32026.name: Wordfare!
32026.description:
WordFare! combines the fun of Scrabble with a good bit of strategy and random chance. Like similar word games, you don't need to be a mastermind to be good at it.

You can learn the rules in a few minutes. Here are most of the rules:

1 Draw 20 tiles at random, pick the 10 you like best and put them on your row #1 (the row facing you)
2 Roll 2 dice, select one and move a tile that many spaces in a straight line. Save the other one to use later.
3 Your opponent does the same. As your letters move together, you can form words with either player's letters.

You score based on how far away from your home row the letters are, times the length of the word. There are blank tiles and a special * tile, used to replace any letter. The * tile can only be used by the player who owns it; the blanks can be used by either player. There are a couple of other simple rules involving capture of letter tiles, but you get the idea.

The board and pieces are made of hardwood and are laser engraved. Even the box is made of hardboard and is engraved.

32027.name: "Play Ball"
32027.description: In 1978, most Topps baseball cards had an at-bat result on the back, like Fly Out, Double, or Ground Out. These were to be used in a two-player game. A few of the cards had the complete rules on them. Players would take turns playing three-out innings, pulling cards from the top of a deck and scoring runs (if any) until three outs were drawn, at which point the turn would pass to the other player. The game would be played to nine innings, with extra innings in the case of ties.

32028.name: Tank Commander
32028.description:
Command and plan your Tank Battles.

In this war situation, you are the commander of a forward tank unit and the objective is to gain control of this map sector by destroying the enemy supply base, and thus force a total retreat, or by knocking out enough enemy tanks so that they concede defeat.

Both players have 10 tanks, 2 transporters and 3 bridges at their disposal to beat the enemy.

A transporter can move bridges or tanks that were shot.

The board shows rivers, mountains and flat terrain, that result in movement and shooting ristrictions.

32029.name: Rombo: Il gioco a tutto motore F.1
32029.description:
A simple non roll&move F1 racing game. Use your fuel coin to reach the different gas station on the race track and get more (random cards) fuel.

Content:
- 4 painted metal f1 model 1/55 by Polistil (FERRARI 126 C3, BRABHAM BT 52, RENAULT RE 40, Mc LAREN-MP4).
- 60 fuel coin.
- 18 squared cards, 15 fuel bag (with differt values) and 3 accident.

32030.name: BIS: Il nuovo gioco a premi ideato da Mike Bongiorno
32030.description:
An italian tv-show created by Mike Bongiorno in 1981. Two people plays a memory contest collecting prizes (tv, shoes, gadgets, etc.) discovery a puzzle-rebus behind the table.

Content:
- a trasparent table with 36 boxes.
- 36 boxes numbers
- 15 couples of prizes
- 2 "give a prize"
- 2 "get a prize"
- 2 "jolly"
- 15 double faces sheet with the puzzle-rebus.

32031.description:
The Art of War is a strategy game for 2-6 players played on a board divided into black, white and forest hexes. The players must strategically move and produce units in order to conquer the capital of the opposing player(s). There are only two kinds of units: military and civilian. Civilian units are used to produce new units; military units attack and defend.

The gameplay is very simple. On a turn, players may either produce new pieces or move their existing pieces. It is a game of planning the buildup to battle and putting ones forces in an advantageous position. It is not a game of doing battle and hoping to get lucky.

The length of the game depends on the number of players

2 players: 20-30 minutes
3 players: 30-60 minutes
4 players: 60-90 minutes
6 players: 90-120 minutes
32031.name: Art of War

32032.name: Monopoly: Electronic Banking
32032.description: Monopoly: Electronic Banking Edition uses the properties and other changes found in 2006's Here and Now Edition, and it adds a new element: debit cards in place of cash.

32033.name: Etch-A-Sketch Games Pack
32033.description: This is a cool set of overlays that allow solo play or pass back and forth type games for 2 players. Most games have solo options, but not all. It really brings new life to the Etch-A-Sketch.

32034.name: Build-a-Thomas Game
32034.description:
Be the first player to collect all eight pieces and build Thomas to win!

Players spin the spinner, and collect the piece of Thomas indicated. You can then place the piece on the base, building up your Thomas. The first player to complete their Thomas wins.

Play can continue for a number of games. Players get one point for each piece collected and that becomes their score for the game. You can either play a fixed number of rounds, or see who reaches a set score first.

32035.name: Peopling
32035.description:
Be the first player to populate the central goal line with your pawns. How you accomplish this can differ depending on the rule variant used. Examples include:

King of the Hill: Roll the dice and move one pawn either the number of spaces shown on one die, or the total of the two dice. Keep rolling and moving until a six is showing on either die, or doubles other than ones are rolled.

King of Battle: Roll the dice. Not only are you attempting to get your men to the goal line, but you are also shooting at them in an attempt to hinder their progress. Wounded pawns are removed from the board, but can be re-introduced later.

Virtually Golfing: Each track is a hole, and are played sequentially. Roll the dice, and move your pawn the lower of the two numbers towards the goal. Roll double ones and you hole out. Any other doubles mean a swing and a miss. Par is 5 for each hole, and the lowest score after all holes are played wins.

Game includes 12 pawns (6 of each color), two dice, rules, and a game board. The rules and game board can also be downloaded and printed from the http://game.peopling.net/ website, and played using your own pawns and dice.

32036.name: Monopoly: Grand Rapids Edition
32036.description:
This is the Grand Rapids, Michigan edition of Monopoloy producted by USAopoly. Here is an article on the students from Grand Valley State University who helped develop the game.

http://www.youngmoney.com/entrepreneur/student_entrepreneurs...

The following is from a GVSU press release.

Grand Rapids Monopoly to raise scholarshp money

A student organization at Grand Valley State University's Seidman College of Business has created a Grand Rapids themed version of the board game Monopoly. Soon players will be able to buy companies like Alticor, Meijer and Steelcase while moving pieces shaped like local landmarks like Calder's La Grande Vitesse.

The project was spearheaded by the Collegiate Entrepreneurs' Organization (CEO) at Grand Valley. Business sponsorships and sales of the game will raise funds to establish a CEO student scholarship at Grand Valley.
The game board is patterned after the familiar Monopoly board, but it features prominent local businesses in the place of the original names. Boardwalk is Alticor, Park Place is Meijer, and Steelcase is Pacific Avenue (the three highest valued properties in the game). Other featured businesses are Behler-Young, Louis Padnos Iron and Metal Company, The Gilmore Collection, 1913 Room, Rockford Construction, Old Orchard, WZZM, Grand Valley State, Calvin College, and Aquinas College. The hotels will be shaped as the Amway Grand, and houses will represent the conservatory at the Frederick Meijer Gardens. Tokens will also be shaped as local attractions, such as the La Grande Vitesse, Leonardo Da Vinci Horse, John Ball statue, and other area landmarks.

Full text availalble here:
http://www.gvsu.edu/forms/ceo/Media/monopoly2.pdf

Another article on the project may be found here:
http://www.gvsu.edu/successstory/index.cfm?fuseaction=home.s...;id=FA32E53B-E926-4249-DCBD5FC17644C204

32037.name: Toy Town Railroad Game
32037.description: This is a simple roll and move game from Parker Brothers. The box says that the game contains Rail Road Tickets, Pullman Tickets, and Toy Money.

32038.description:
Kalamazoo is for sale!
Give the gift of Kalamazoo with Kalamazoo On Board.
Kalamazoo On Board is an exciting, one-of-a-kind celebration of community based on the famous "opoly" style real estate trading game. The game is customized specifically for Kalamazoo and showcases the businesses and attractions that make Kalamazoo so special.

Kalamazoo On Board is available at any Kalamazoo County Harding’s, Felpausch or D & W for only $34.99. Quantities are limited. Proceeds benefit the YWCA of Kalamazoo. Call (269)345.5595 for more information.
YWCA of Kalamazoo
http://www.ywca.org/site/apps/s/content.asp?c=bpLJJTOvHmE&am...;b=420727&ct=1210179
32038.name: Kalamazoo on Board

32039.name: Cranium Grab & Go Checkers Extreme
32039.description:
From the publisher:

Checkers with fun Cranium twists!
Compact package makes it ideal for travel
Fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends
Are you the king of king me? Get your hands on Checkers Extreme!

Play checkers the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like a 6-sided die and special Cranium spots on the board.

What's in the box? Checkers Extreme includes 24 green and yellow checker tokens, 6 checker crowns, the game board, and a 6-sided die.

32040.name: Cranium Grab & Go Super Jacks
32040.description:
From the publisher:

The game of jacks gets fun Cranium twists!
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Super Jacks!

Play jacks the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists. Can you play with your opposite hand? Can you spin the jack like a top on the lid of the can?

What's in the box? Super Jacks includes 10 jacks and 2 bouncy Cranium balls.

32041.name: Cranium Grab & Go Super Sudoku
32041.description:
From the publisher:

The game of sudoku with fun Cranium twists
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Super Sudoku!

Get to know sudoku by playing with fun animal stickers on a smaller grid, then graduate to traditional play on a larger, more challenging grid.

What's in the box? Super Sudoku includes 2 game booklets (with 60 sudoku animal and number challenges), fun animal clings, 2 dry-erase pens, and double-sided puzzle board.

32042.name: Cranium Grab & Go Mancala Mania
32042.description:
From the publisher:

The game of Mancala with fun Cranium twists! Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel. Fun for kids -- and adults! Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones.
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mancala Mania! A favorite of young and old alike, mancala is an ancient game loved worldwide for its unique combination of simplicity and strategy.

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like reconfiguring the board to create an entirely new game!

Contents:
6-Piece Mancala Board
48 Tokens
6-Sided Die

32043.name: The 3 Little Pigs
32043.description:
This is a spin-and-move game about the three little pigs. On the box cover, the wolf is bigger than the pigs' brick house.

"Based on the movie sensation!"

32044.name: Young People's Bible Game: David and Goliath
32044.description: In this game from the 1890s, one player reads a card while the other guesses the subject. If correct, they get the card.

32045.name: Reward
32045.description:
With marbles and dice, reward money and a villain trying to hide, this game is played on a 3D plastic board. Find the villain and be careful not to fall down the mountain.

The box cover features a head shot of the villain, who is wearing a white hat and has a large mustache.

32046.name: Boomtown: The Building of a City
32046.description: An economic board game in which players try to make the most money and build a successful city. Players can buy land, build businesses, make money and then wreck havoc on the other players with some crime, fire, lawsuits or taxation. Features both basic and advanced rules. Will also have a stock market expansion.

32047.name: The Circle
32047.description:
1889, the Victorian Age, an age of change.

The most advanced nations are fighting for total economic control. It is the perfect breeding ground for a secret society more dangerous than the Yakuza, more mysterious than the Illuminati -- "The Circle".

2 - 6 players each control one secret agency trying to protect humanity against the Circle's ultimate goal: complete Global domination.

Each round, players hire spies to uncover the Circle's secrets, infiltrate its ranks, and capture its members. Sometimes the players must cooperate to reach their goals, but often they are competing against each other. At the end of the game if you have placed the most spies within the Circle's ranks, you will be able to destroy the secret society and win the game. But be careful: the Circle could defeat all of the players.

This box contains 121 Game Pieces in different colors, 60 Spy Cards, 1 Time Wheel, 6 Secret Agency markers, 1 Victory Point table, 1 Starting Player dial, 1 plastic rivet and 1 multilingual (German and English) rulebook.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
32048.description:
Robin the bumblebee is looking for honey. As he buzzes about, use your paddle to bop him away. Be the last to lose your honey discs and win!

In the spirit of Looping Louie, this action/dexterity game will keep children of all ages enthralled.

Two to four players and Ages 3 and up recommended.

This is a reworked (different theme, other incidental changes) version of Loopin' Louie.
32048.name: Bobbin' Bumblebee

32049.name: Rainbow Riders
32049.description:
The first player to get their Rainbow Rider over the Rainbow & into the Pot of Gold wins the game. To do this, your Rainbow Rider must be on the fifth piece of the Rainbow of any colour & then you must roll that same colour again, thus reaching the Pot of Gold. (But don't stop playing ! Finish building the entire Rainbow by rolling the die until all of the Rainbow sections have been placed on the game board !)

Another beautifully produced game from Ravensburger !

Contents

1 x Game board

25 x Coloured Rainbow pieces

4 x Rainbow riders

1 x Coloured die

1 x Instructions leaflet

32050.name: MapleStory iTrading Card Game
32050.description:
MapleStory iTCG is an interactive trading card game based on the MapleStory MMORPG. The Maple Story iTCG lets you play a character leading a party to duel with your opponent. The object of the game is reduce your opponent's HP to 0 using skills, items, and monsters.

The MapleStory iTCG plays much like its online counterpart as characters battle monsters and level up yet adds the unique element of character versus character combat. The game is available in starter sets and booster packs. Boosters contain 9 cards (including one code). Starter sets contain 34 cards (including one code), one booster pack, game rules and a CD-ROM with the MapleStory online game client.

Each pack contains at least one Online code card which can be redeemed for exclusive content in the MapleStory MMORPG.

32051.name: Operation Westindien
32051.description:
Operation Westindien simulates the devastating effects of the German U-boats in the Caribbean from Feb. 16 to March 16. While Operation Paukenschlag (an upcoming ATO game) began along the US East Coast at the same time (equally devastating), a handful of U-boats, Group Neuland, were ordered to deploy in the Caribbean.

Unknown to most today, in 1942, the oil refineries at Aruba, Curacao, and Trinidad were vital in refining the oil arriving from Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. Canada heavily relied on this oil, the US and England, also needed this oil for aviation fuel. For the Germans, it was a missed opportunity to really devastate the Allied oil and fuel production, which would have long lasting impact on the war.

Game Details:

System: Double Blind to capture the true flavor of submarine warfare (can be played solitaire), point to point movement

Counters: 280 Map: One 11x17 inch depicting the Caribbean area south of Cuba

Unique rules cover: Aircraft ASW radar, U-boat surface and sub-surface strengths and speeds, U-boat fuel limitations, Torpedo and U-boat surface attacks, Lake tankers, Cargo ships, B-18, A-20 bombers, Destroyers, ASW Ships, Landing saboteurs, Port Capacity.

Unlike every submarine game made, this game forces both players to complete different objectives. For the German, it is to sink cargo and oil tankers in demanding quantities and or destroy oil refineries, depending on orders. The German must find and sink tankers with oil cargo moving to refineries. For the Allied player, they must move their oil and cargo ships across the map. Oil tankers must land at a refinery, unload the oil, refine it, reload it and then move the tanker off the map with the oil through U-boat infested water. Cargo ships with non-oil material must also cross the map. Of course, their other objective is to use their bombers and meager ASW force to sink U-boats!

Available in both DTP and Print-n-Play

32052.name: Formes et couleurs
32052.description: Formes et couleurs (french title) is a Winnie The Pooh themed game for children 3 and up. Each player takes a board with a drawn scene and tries to fill the colored shapes on it. To do so they roll one shape-die (and one color-die if they are older) and are allowed to place a piece of the matching shape (and color with the advanced rules). If they have no more matching shape on their board, they have to pass. It helps children learn shapes and colors.

32053.name: 3 for me
32053.description: 3 For Me is made of 48 tiles with a different drawing on each of them. The idea of the game is to find 3 tiles with something in common; it can be "red things", "warm things", "things with a hole", "things that fly"... There are 3 games in one: the search game (4 and up), the fish style game (6 and up) and the advanced memory game (8 and up). It's very enjoyable for the whole family.

32054.name: Tchic-tchac
32054.description: Tchic-tchac is a game for children 4 and up made of a board with 4 x 4 pegs. To start, you randomly place the 16 cubes (4 of each of the 4 colors) on the pegs and you draw one of the several cards where a 4 x 4 pattern is drawn. Your goal is to reach this pattern with a minimum number of swaps ideally in less time than your opponent.

32055.name: Overload
32055.description:
The object of this game is to transport your trucks and containers from the start to an unloading bay avoiding as many penalties as possible.

Some of the loads are overweight and being caught with an overweight load means going back to the start.

There are squares to avoid (breakdowns, punctures and out of fuel) as well as some safety squares (truck parks), but the game is, in essence, a a race to get your loads from the start to the finish before anybody else.

One player plays the Police and cannot win the game - his goal is to hinder the other players as much as possible. (This is probably best played by a parent or Games Master. Alternatively, the Police car can be moved by mutual agreement, which makes the game playable by 2 to 6 players.)

32056.name: Cap'n Tock
32056.description: Cap'n Tock is a pirate-themed tock game for children. To win the game, each of the 3 ships (tokens) of a player must go around the board and end up on the treasure island. Movements are decided using the magic wheel you spin on your turn; it shows either one of the 4 colors there are on the squares on the board or the wind symbol. Colors allow you to move a ship to the next square of that color clockwise. If you land on an opponent boat, it cannot move as long as you stay there. The wind symbol allows you to launch a new boat OR move to the next wind square and play again with the same boat OR free your boat from an enemy (going to next wind square) and play again.

32057.name: Verenigde Indische Compagnieen (VIC)
32057.description:
A Dutch family game from the early postwar days (estimated).

On a very large and beautifully illustrated game board players round the globe with their ships in order to try to acquire commodities to make the most profit.
The commodities come in large amounts (51 sets of 4), such making the numbers up to 204.
The more you collect from one set, the larger your profit.
There are special rules for handling the hazards, entering a port, encountering an opponents ship, selling your commodities etc.

Voyage is done by 6 thick cardboard ships, payment is made with an uncountable amount of thin cardboard gold coins in different values.

32058.name: Fami Train
32058.description:
A French family game from the late 60ies/early 70ies.

Game consists of a large gameboard depicting a railroad track, 12 cardboard locomotives in 6 colours, a load of cardboard wagons, movement and hazard cards, 6 player mats, two dice and a load of commodity cards.

Aim of the game is to be the first to add 5 wagons to your locomotive and to fill these wagons with given commodities (passengers, postal freight, dishes etc.)

Certain rules allow to exchange in excess acquired commodities with other ones or to buy a wagon for these.

32059.name: Special Train
32059.description:
A real 2-player game gem from the early post war days.

Game consists of the game board, 20 tiny, hand painted tin locomotives in a pre-war design, a dice cup and a dice.

Every player has 3 express trains (dark and light red), 3 passenger trains(dark and light green), 3 goods trains (dark and light blue) and a special train (yellow).

Aim of the game is to send all your trains from the starting station to the end station on the opposite side of the board.
Every kind of train has a fixed movement allowance: Expresses 4 squares, passengers 3 sq. and goods 2 sq.
The die only shows how many of your trains you can move, which ones you take is for your own decision.
If you pass on your throw you can move any given train one square back.

The cracker of the game is the name-giving special train lurking in the backyard of your starting station: This can be triggered by your opponent !!!

Once he has done this (or you have done this to him) by throwing a six at any time in the game (your choice), no one stops the special train.
No matter what your throw is, the special train always moves six squares.
So everyone off into the sideways - but these are shared with your opponent, and only one train can occupy a sideway at any time.

Beware: If there is at any time the special train blocked by one of your own trains so it cannot move its 6 squares - you have lost the game...
And if you think you have managed to avoid the yellow monster - it returns a second time !

32060.name: Kwest: A Game of the Sea
32060.description:
Game comes like most Geographia Games with a separate board and a somewhat tiny components box.

Components are 50 sailing cards (45 with a single and 5 with a double sailing symbol), 5 location cards, 15 treasure cards, two cardboard ships on wooden stands, a wooden dice cup containing a special dice.

After setting up your starting hand (15 cards with the possibility to replace from the stockpile) you draw a location card where to dig up a pirates treasure.
Sailing is done with the symbol cards, also depicted on the different sailing routes on the board.
You have to fiddle out the best and farthest calculated moves with your hand, double symbol cards allowing double moves.
In the storm reigned region in the middle of the board you have to use the special dice, depicting the standard card symbols (spade, heart, club and diamond) and 2 anchors.

If you reach your destination island you have to land on the shores, now rolling an anchor on the dice.

If you dare, you can try to plunder another island on your way back to homeport, but beware: Winner is the one returning home first with a treasure !

What adds additional spice is the possibility to capture the opponents ship and that the movement cards are randomly chosen after you emptied your starting hand, so no more calculating your route is possible.

32061.name: Battle Royal
32061.description:
This is one of the scarce Pepys boardgame editions.

It came in two versions: One with separate board and small components box and one with a large box, containing board and components.

Game consists of 54 playing pawns in 4 colours (small wooden cylinders), 3 sets of 4 movement cards (depicting one to four knights plus a Zero-knight card, and a large game board depicting a fictious medieval countryside.

Aim is to capture the opponents capital, starting in your own at the opposite end of the board.

At first you have to enter all your pawns onto the board square by square and then move the existing chain of knights towards the other capital.
This is done with the randomly chosen movement cards. The number depicted is the allowance to move as many knights (pawns) from the end of your chain to the front of it.
Obstacles hinder a smooth movement, and you can capture opponents knights or even cut his knights-chain off !
For all these actions you have to show the right movement card, some actions require 4 knights.

For the time edited (around 1950) a very good strategy game with much room for decision making what to do best with the random movement card. The beautifully designed gameboard adds to the atmosphere...

32062.description:
In times before the Fackler-Games this must be the most expensive game edition.
It was a personal dream of the author to become true, 1000 were intended to be made.

The game consists of: 1 three-dimensional wooden board, measuring approx. 1 yard square, 62 cherries in 3 colours (1 inch diameter) 62 leaves in 3 colours, 15 bonus-cherries, 42 point-allowance-pawns and 4 coloured birds on trees as playing pawns, all made of wood too.

Name of the game means "Royal Cherry".

After setting up the game with the beautiful components mentioned above players start to move their birds in the centre field measuring 7 x 6 squares, containing the point-allowance-pawns depicting leaves and cherries in alternate appearance.
The number depicted is the maximum you can harvest from a certain tree (cherries or leaves).
After your move the bird sits in the hole left by the pawn. Next time your move has to start from there, such restricting your further moves.
Aim of the game is to go for the bonus cherries counting points at the end.
You can earn them being the LAST one harvesting a tree or by being the one with the most cherries and leaves harvested from a certain tree.
As the trees have three different sizes, there are different amounts of bonus cherries to gain.

This is not a game for children, you have to twist your brain for the best moves !
32062.name: Kirsch Royal

32063.name: Generic Outlandishly Big Spacefleets (GOBS)
32063.description:
From the introduction:

"Generic Outlandishly Big Spacefleets! is the game where you control vast fleets of vessels of all shapes and sizes, from nimble little fighters to moon-sized planetsmashers. Move your ships. Fire your weapons. Launch your torpedoes. And watch your enemies explode into brilliant flashes of molten metal! Everything a budding megalomaniac... err, defender of the galaxy... could want!

G.O.B.S.! is designed to allow you to build big, custom spacefleets and fight quick, explosive battles with simple rules and little or no record keeping. Just move, shoot, and (probably) explode. What could be more fun? Best of all, you can use G.O.B.S.! with any spaceship miniatures you like, from those expensive metal jobs to cheap plastic toys to scratch-built wonders made from household items. (Yours truly is contemplating a fleet made from seashells.)

In G.O.B.S.!, a ship’s speed and combat worthiness are determined by the size and apparent purpose of the miniature(or whatever the manufacturer happens to call the thing). Players may then customize the armament to reflect their preferences.
Big ships are slow, clumsy, and easy to hit. They also carry lots and lots of weapons and are both very dangerous and hard to destroy.

Smaller ships are fast and nimble, and very hard to hit. However, they carry few weapons and are very easy to destroy.

The movement and combat systems of G.O.B.S.! are designed to reflect these general principles."

Download G.O.B.S.! at:

Homepage: http://www.thegobspage.com

32064.name: Skag the Yuppie
32064.description: A simple, humorous wargame depicting a neighborhood defending itself against a horde of yuppies bent on moving in. Movement and combat are die-based, and involve both conventional weapons and "Bad Taste" weapons such as belches and loud shirts.

32065.name: Person-alysis
32065.description:
From the the insdtruction book:
One of the most exciting, ever changing human attributes is the MIND. The way you think--the way your family, friends, neighbors think--why you think one way one time and another way at another. Because your mind is YOU, the game PERSON--ALYSIS was created.
PERSON--ALYSIS is a revealing psychological game for adults based on the latest psycho-scientific testing techniques. It consists primarily of specially prepared ink blots and can be played by 4 or more alduts

Contents:

20-cards with 40- specially designed ink blots **
a specially designed ink blot holder **
"interpretation" sheets **
scoring pad **
booklet on interpretations and their meanings" **

32066.name: Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy's Flying Hat Game
32066.description:
This is a children's Game base on the vintage TV Characters Edgar Bergen and is dummy Charlie McCarthy.

It is a simple dexterity game of flicking the "hats" into the game Tin.

32067.description: A book of 15 games based on the adventures of Tintin, the french reporter comic character created by Hergé. The various games range from purely luck driven to more abstract games with no luck whatsoever. Each game fills one or two pages of the book and some require that the players supply additional material (dice, pawns, pen and papers).
32067.name: Jouons avec Tintin à Moulinsart

32068.name: QUEST: An intriguing game of mazes!
32068.description:
Very simple premise - Be the first to get out of the maze and win the game!
The unusual component is the board itself, By twisting the handle in the center, the direction you are forced to move changes, this providing the difficulty.

32069.name: Attraction
32069.description: This game is based around magnetism. The board consists of 80 chips, some of whom are magnetic. Players take turns trying to pick the chips up using a magnetic stick. Differently colored chips are worth a different amount of points, and the player with the most points when all chips have been picked up is the winner.

32070.description:
Gormiti (The Invincible Lords of Nature) is a collectible mineatures game with a very big board.

The player chooses a team of creatures with every creature having a number under their left foot, and a corresponding card with their (single) stats.

The gameboard is divided into squares, and the game consists of moving the creatures and attacking the opponents creatures.

An attack is played out with the attacker moving a monster up to the number under the foot, and then adding the remainder to the number on the creatures card; if this number is larger than the defenders number on foot plus card value, then the attacker wins, else the defender does. The loosing creature is removed from the board.

The winner is the player with the last surviving monsters.
32070.name: Gormiti

32071.name: Crushed Metal
32071.description: A mini-game included with with the WorldWorks Games cardstock model set "Platform Commander: Red Sector". It is a diceless Mech combat game that uses the customisable Mecha and scenery included in the set. There are Basic and Advanced rules versions.

32072.description: Song of Gold and Darkness is the first expansion for the Song of Blades and Heroes fantasy skirmish rules. It includes rules clarifications and complete rules for dungeon adventuring.
32072.name: Song of Gold and Darkness

32073.name: Spell It
32073.description:
Vintage spelling game. Also includes games for arithmetic.

This game features a board with the alphabet written around the edges of a circle in the center of the board. The board is 17.5 x 17.5 inches.

32074.name: Oflameron card game
32074.description:
Unusual version of card game “Oflameron”, in which cards are used for creating a playing field, on which blocks (markers) of players are moved. For playing, you should download images of cards, print the required number of cards and buy or make a usual small playing cube. Any number of players can participate in the game.
You might have participated in such games, in which you move blocks along an artful road depending on the number of points shown on a playing cube thrown. You might have participated in card games. A card version of this game “Oflameron” resembles somehow both games – You should move your blocks (markers) along a road made of playing cards, depending on the number of points shown on a small playing cube thrown. During the game, you will have to estimate income and losses after each step and plan your strategy for achieving the maximal success.
A card game created according to the principle “print-n-play”. All materials (cards, game rules, description) are presented in an electronic form, they are to be printed and then you can start playing. It is convenient – you need not buy anything for starting this game. Any number of players may participate in the game. All is defined by the number of cards and the size of a playing field. A score is kept during the game. All materials are included in a http://card.shmeleff.com/ ZIP archive.

32075.name: Mail Coach Game
32075.description:
"Get the mail through"

This is a spin-and-move game about delivering mail in the old west. It has 4 wood counters and a spinner. The board features art about the American Old West and round colored circles for a movement track.

32076.name: Arabian Game
32076.description: Arabian Game is a game played on a board using regular checkers. The board features red circles with black paths between them. The black paths form three squares with a common center (each larger than the next). 'Arabian Checkers' is written in the center.

32077.name: Meteor Game
32077.description: This game from the 1920s is played with marbles on a hexagon that is five spaces wide on each side. The box cover features a picture of two girls playing the game at a table with a boy sitting on the table looking on.

32078.name: Lightning Express
32078.description:
A family game from the pre-war times (estimated).

Players move their pawns round the railroad track according to the throw of two dice.
The board is part of the game box basement.
The track is colour-coded, so every time you land on a given colour you have to put a passenger chip (from your starting amount) into the station of the corresponding colour.
To add some decision making you can choose if you want to do this on your own colour or not.
Every time 10 passengers have amassed on a station, the complete board (all stations) is swept by the owner.

After a pre-game agreed number of sweeps the game ends and the winner is the player with the most passengers in hand.

A little added spice are some red lights (wooden chips), which are placed in front of a train when the player throws a 2, 3 or 12.
It can only be removed by throwing a 7, 11 or double.
As long as the red light is on, the train thus blocked cannot move nor can the owner sweep the board should his station contain 10 passengers.

32079.name: Gipfel
32079.description:
(Summit)

Introductory text of the game book (in many languages):

Cooperative behavior and mutual assistance

A group of ramblers is preparing for a mountain-climbing expedition to the summit. In the mountains each is dependant on the help of the others. No one person alone should attempt such a climb. A mountain stream may only be crossed with the help of a second player. On a steep rock-face it is even more difficult. The group members have to rope themselves together, so mutual assistance is also necessary. Shortly before the summit, they are threatened by a belt of rain.

32080.name: A.D.T. Messenger Boy
32080.description: Very old track race game the object of which is to take a message to a certain location and then return home.

32081.name: Tom Mix's Game: Wildcat
32081.description: Tom Mix was a "Silent Movie" Cowboy Star from the early days of the movies. He made movies from 1910 to 1935 and of the more than 330 films made all but 9 were Silent Films. This is basically a rummy game with some pictures of western themes.

32082.name: Bonus
32082.description:
From the designers homepage:

Strategic and entertaning cardgame for both adults as well as the whole family. BONUS is easy and fast to learn, but very hard to master! Can be played from the age of 7.

The players must play their cards to the canter of the table - and this way score the fewest possible cardpoints when the game ends. Strategy, tactics and vigilance is a necessity.

BONUS is played by 2, 3 or 4 players! With 2 BONUS games up to 8 players are supported. At 4, 6 or 8 players BONUS can be played as a partnergame!

BONUS is a true international game! 11 different languages are included in the gamerules inside the BONUS box!

32083.description:
A solitaire card game to recall the siege of the legations in the Beijing in 1900 and the relief forces that they were sent to raise the siege.

The alliance of Great Britain, Russia,Germany, Italy, Japan, Italy,Austro-Hungary and the United States,enemies in few years, against the Chinese Empire

The player tries to arrive with the relief forceses at Peking before 55 days. Meanwhile the Boxers attacks the legations to eliminate the defenders.
32083.name: PEKIN 1900

32084.description:
Covers 15 scenarios for the Harpoon system of modern naval warfare. These 15 scenarios cover the hypothetical war between NATO and Soviet forces during the 1980's.


The Harpoon Series
32084.name: Battles of the Third World War

32085.name: Sharpe's Skirmish
32085.description:
The rules for the Durham's Chosen Men 40mm demo game of skirmishes in the napoleonic age are currently free to download.
This game did all the rounds in 2006 and won many awards for best demo game and has a high grade of detail while still being easy accessible and quick to learn.

32086.name: Harc Európáért
32086.description:
Original description from the bottom of the game's box

Our new boardgame 'Struggle for Europe' portrays in a realistic way the events
which took place in Europe and Northern Africa between 1939 and 1945.
But our game contains much more than this. It also gives the opportunity to carry
through actions which did not happen, for example - The Germans' landing in England
or the breaking through of the Allies in the Balkans.

Moreover, 'Struggle for Europe' actually includes 8 games in one:
1. Sickle-cut. (Hitler's strategy to occupy France)
2. Barbarossa plan. (Hitler's strategy to occupy Moscow, etc.)
3. Military operations 'Bagration and Overlord'. (The Allies terms for 2 separate
plans to land in Europe and occupy Berlin)
4. The entire campaign in Europe and Northern Africa.
Each of the above has 2 versions, one for beginners and one for advanced players.
The game is played on a mapboard printed on both sides.
The conditions for victory of the different participating countries (i.e. players)
vary, for example, Italy could remain neutral and still win the game, even if the Allied
troops occupy Berlin.

All the elements of warfare can be found in this game - infantry, armed troops, navy,
airforce, paratroops, bombers, artillery*, planes and submarines represented by about
200 markers.
The battles are settled in a simple and clearly defined way. Long-term strategic planning
plays an important role and players are also obliged to make decision in financial matters.

[*There are no artillery pieces in the game. It is only mentioned in the English description,
probably by mistake.]

32087.description:
This game is simulates a rugby competition involving 2 to 4 players. It is a quick little game, where players are in charge of two rugby teams they must lead to the final.
Players put attacking cards which the opponents must counter before attacking themselves. When an opponent cannot counter and attack, the match is won by the attacking player, and the next match in the competition is played.
32087.name: Rugby Challenge

32088.name: Zagadki Smoka Obiboka
32088.description:
"Riddles of Lazybones the Dragon" - as the title translates to English - is a children trivia game. The game contains 135 cards with rhymed riddles on one side and pictures showing the answer . For correct answers players get tokens with appropriate drawings on. The owner of most tokens wins.

Sequel:

Nowe Zagadki Smoka Obiboka

32089.name: Space Colony Cheeses
32089.description:
From the rules:

You are in charge of colonizing a newly discovered world, Bos III. Your task is to build a thriving, profitable dairy colony. You must choose when, where and how to expand. You'll have to balance the need for money-making modules against the need for energy production. If you can afford it, you may want to expand into other dairy products, increase your storage capacity, or just harass the competition with endless lawsuits. The choices, and the responsibility, are yours.

Space Colony Cheeses is a light-hearted, non-violent game for 2-4 players. The game includes a map, score sheets and game counters; all you provide is one or two six-sided dice.

32090.name: Apostolos
32090.description:
From the rules:

Apostle lets you take the role of a first-century apostle of Christ. Each player controls one or more Christian workers who start churches, help them grow, and protect them against false doctrines. You often have to choose between starting a new church or strengthening an existing one; improving your own churches or aiding another player in trouble; and spending score points on a new worker or saving them for a higher score. Hopefully, as you play this game, you'll appreciate what our missionaries have to go through today.

32091.name: To A Pulp
32091.description:
Fast-playing, simple pulp-gaming rules that use free downloadable paper counters and four kinds of map sets (included). 2+ players.

From the rules:

Pulp gaming, in which each player controls a character or faction from a 1930's pulp thriller, is growing in popularity. Such games combine the visual appeal of miniatures gaming with aspects of role-playing games, allowing the players to control the actions of tough private eyes, seemingly-helpless dames, brave explorers, and all the rest.

The rules are made for simplicity and fast play. The game is meant for use with miniatures, but you can download a set of paper minis for free. All you have to provide is a few six-sided (d6) and ten-sided (d10) dice. The game is meant for two or more players, but it can be used for solo gaming as well.

32092.name: SuperGuys
32092.description:
From the rules:

Saga City. This town has stories to tell, and you're about to write one of them. Two teams of super-heroes call Saga City their home. Both teams want the honor of defending the city, but this town isn't big enough for both of them. So a battle has been decreed. You must build a super-team with the powers and abilities you think will bring victory, then fight it out against the other team.

This is a 2-player game with the emphasis on simple rules and fast play. Dozens of different powers and interactions will keep the game from growing stale. Record-keeping is simplified by the use of track sheets and sliders. The game set includes counters and markers, and uses my M8 maps. All you need to provide is a few six-sided dice.

32093.name: The Wars of David
32093.description: The Wars of David is a two-player game set in ancient times: "Ancient warfare between the kingdom of Israel and her eight angry neighbors".

32094.description:
Patrol troubled waters in search of enemy forces in this Harpoon Series supplement. Troubled Waters covers the turbulent Middle East since 1973 and showcases the introduction of antiship missiles as a dominant factor in modern naval combat.

Modern antiship missiles allow fearsome striking power to be carried in tiny vessels. As commander of one of these "eggshells armed with sledgehammers", it will be your task to strike first and strike hard at the enemies of your nation, whether they come in the form of fast, vicious craft like your own, or as a huge carrier battlegroup.

As commander of a carrier battlegroup, you must contend with tense, portentous confrontations short of war. A nerve-wracking game of cat-and-mouse, full of posturings, threats and test of intent, must be played before the order can be given: "Weapons free". To assist you in your mission, Troubled Waters contains:
- 40 new Ship Data Forms, from tiny patrol boats to a venerable aircraft carrier.
- 10 new Aircraft Data Forms, from special operations helos to Mach 2 interceptors.
- Missile and radar data for Soviet exported SA-2, SA-3, and SA-5 SAM systems.
- Detailed carrier air wing compositions for 1986-1991 operations.

In order to recreate the dramatic events of this period, Troubled Waters presents 10 new scenarios covering Middle East naval clashes from 1973 to the present day:
- 1973 Arab-Israeli War
- Iran-Iraq War, 1980
- Persian Gulf Tanker War, 1984-88
- "Line of Death," 1986
- US reprisals against Iran, 1988
- Operation Desert Storm, 1991

In addition, six scenario generators allow players to create and fight hypothetical battles with accurate forces from the coast of North Africa to the Strait of Hormuz.

With Harpoon and Troubled Waters, the possibilities of the last 18 violent years of Middle East history are laid before you. The risks are yours to confront. The decisions are yours to make.
32094.name: Troubled Waters

32095.description:
This expansion adds 4 Card/Board Game Pieces and 4 Oversized Elemental/Minion Game Boards that can be shuffled into the base deck for more danger.

Expansion to Dragon War
32095.name: Dragon War: Elemental Furies

32096.description:
This expansion contains 1 oversized board, 2 castle gate cards, and a deck of monster cards that populate the dungeon for all players to escape from.

Expansion to Dragon War
32096.name: Dragon War: Castle of Doom

32097.description: This expansion to Dragon War adds nine cards and four key cards that create a Haunted House for all players to escape. This requires one of the keys, found in the dangerous shifting house.
32097.name: Dragon War: Escape from the Haunted House

32098.description: This expansion to Dragon War adds 20 Magic Item cards for the players to use.
32098.name: Dragon War: Artifacts of Avalon

32099.description: This expansion to Dragon War adds four Dragon Cards and four Dragon counters. The cards are two-sided, so there are eight allies for players to attempt to win to their side, by accomplishing six different Alliance tasks in the game. Once a Dragon Ally's allegiance is won, its powers are yours to command. Each Ally has different powers.
32099.name: Dragon War: Dragon Allies

32100.description: This expansion to Dragon War collects all 105 Alien cards to abduct and hassle the players.
32100.name: Dragon War: Alien Invasion

32101.name: Dragon War: X-Pack
32101.description: This expansion to Dragon War collects 14 full-color art gallery cards and 98 game cards (seven for each gallery card) to add more options for the players.

32102.name: Multimo
32102.description:
This is a game for two players or two teams. Each party has a grid of 8 by 10 in which they have to construct a crossing word. Both players get the same letters. They place these letters on their own grid in trying to make the most points as possible. Once a letter has been placed it shouldn't be moved anymore.
The player (or team) who gains the most points wins the game.

32103.name: Velomaster
32103.description:
Velomaster is a cycling game for 2 to 4 players. Each player manages a team of 4 cyclists with a leader. Players move using a 6-sided die and according to the type of surface they are on. A 20-sided die is used to determine the effort and the skill of the cyclists. The game besides chance also requires and tactical choices: how to position, how to try an escape, how to roll in team or make alliances.
There are basic, advanced and expert rules.

Official site: http://www.velomaster.fr
for player: http://www.velomaster.new.fr

32105.name: Ick: The Game
32105.description:
As written on the webpage,
Welcome to the world of Ick! where you're only as good as you are gross. In this fast-paced game, players collect a colorful assortment of monster cards and place their monster's favorite gross stuff (from toxic slime to gooey eyeballs and severed limbs) into a monster's dream house—a mildew-infested shack. King Stink cards can steal a player's loot of monsters and gross stuff, allowing for plenty of quick, silly play. When the cards run out, tally up the points—whoever collects the most gross stuff wins! Official Site

Basically it's as above, players get hand full of cards, set down a house card (if they have one) put crap in it (making as many objects as they can) and capping off with the monster that belongs with the last object placed. That is player A has 6 cards on his turn; A house, a band-aid, fish bones, rotten veggies, maggots, and the monster known as Slimon. He lays down the house card, followed by all of the item cards he has except the maggots. He can either end his turn or place the maggot card and the Slimon monster card to end that pile of cards from play to others except for the one monster that takes over any house. Basically the objects add up 5 points each and the first person to 100 wins the game.

32107.name: Cro-Magnon
32107.description:
In this kind of themed "Time's up" game you have to adopt the eccentric habits of your tribe and evolve it (or fail). In a wacky environment you have to rediscover your ancestral skills such as chacoal sketching, primitive speech, miming and modeling. Help the members of your tribe guessing words and move ahead in this aventure. Give in to the primal instinct dormant in you and let it lead to your victory. Only the hominid who plays one's role and evolves correctly to the stage of Homo Sapiens will win the game.

The game contains of
- one game board
- 12 descriptive tribal cards
- 135 "Wutzdat" Cards
- 1 timer
- 1 charcoal stick
- modelling clay
- 1 list of primitive vocabulary
- 1 fact booklet
- 1 rules book

32108.name: Freeway Frenzy
32108.description:
Freeway Frenzy is a board game inspired by Utah's road construction over the past few years.

The object of the game is simple: Drive into town using a freeway system and city streets to do your errands, then be first to return home to win the game. Construction barricades and other driving hazards may force you to detour, while you try to block other players with hazards of your own.

32109.description:
An electronic music version of the trivia board game. Two teams sit in such a way that they are in between two of their opponents and facing everyone. The game is much like Hot Potato; a song and artist appears on the screen of the handheld device. The player currently holding it must get one of their teammates to correctly guess the name of the song. They must do this without saying any part of a word on the screen, rhyming any parts of those words, or saying the first letter of any of those words. When a teammate guesses correctly, the device is passed to the left for the other team to do the same. The round ends when an internal timer runs out and a buzzer sounds. The team not holding the device at that time scores a point.

There are two ways to play, and scoring is different in each. The first is similar to classic Catch Phrase. However, if you wish to incorporate singing into the game, the other version adds an extra point for any clue that is sung, if the team guesses correctly.

The game has 9 categories to choose from each round: Pop Mix, 70s, 80s 90s, 2000s, Classic Rock, Hip Hop/R&B, Country, Oldies.

The game requires 3 AAA batteries, not included.
32109.name: Electronic Catch Phrase: Music Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

32110.description: Volume II of the CSIR (Corpo di Spedizione Italiano in Russia) series of expansions for Advanced Tobruk System, depicting the intense battles between Russian and Italian forces in the Orlovka and Ivanovka areas during Christmas, 1941. Containing two new maps and new scenarios ownership of any "full" Eastern Front ATS title is required to use this expansion. Projected release date Fall 2007.
32110.name: ATS: Avanti Savoia!

32111.name: The Prisoner Board Game
32111.description:
Brief Synopsis from the rules: The Prisoner Board Game recreates, for 2 to 6 players, the structure and workings of the outwardly beautiful yet deeply sinister "Village" as featured in the celebrated 1960s TV series.

Each player assumes the role of a "Prisoner" who, having resigned from a secret government job, has been abducted, awaking to find him/herself in the "Village".

32112.name: Hex-O-Gram
32112.description:
Hex-o-gram is similar to Tri-Ominos, except much more colorful.
There are 48 pieces, each with three arrowhead-shaped colored panes.
45 of the pieces have unique combinations of 5 colors. Three pieces
are all white "wildcards".

Each player has a "hand" of tiles, and scores by emptying his hand,
or by forming hexagonal patterns in the playing area.

32113.name: Give Us A Job
32113.description:
Give Us A Job is a roll and move game where players are trying to get a job, keep it, and then gather enough money to be able to buy five luxury items and have £100,000 in cash.

There are chance cards and players collect a salary every time they pass their home square.

The items required to win the game are: a helicopter, a house, a yacht, a sports car and a swimming pool (whether they have a house to go with it or not). Sadly, these are represented by cards rather than models.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Fairplay À la carte Winner
2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
32114.description:
description from pegasus.de :

The 16th century marks the beginning of a new age. America is discovered, the spice route to India is established and the exchange of goods in Europe becomes more and more easy. Huge merchant ships are at home on the sea.

Players take the role of the Fuggers, Welsers, Voehlins or Hoechstetters (all powerful families at that time) and try to maximize their income through clever trade with goods and use of their wares-cards. To win the game, you need to benefit from competitors' actions.

From Catalyst Game Labs:
The 16th and 17th Centuries open a new era in trade. The Americas are newly colonized, and large merchant-vessels ply the sea lanes, bringing resources back to a desperate England. Lead one of four emerging families destined to control this swelling market. Be bold, realize the biggest profit!

Every player starts with three Good Cards, two Ship Cards and one Goods Token on each ship corresponding to one of the six Goods Cards in the game: Indigo, Fur, Corn, Lumber, Fish and Cotton. Every turn a player may draw or play various cards. This can change Goods Tokens on player's Ship Cards, the face-up Goods Cards on the playing area, trigger scoring, and so on.

Re-implementation of:

Ferkelei, with a number of changes (there are things to buy other than more cubes, and the scoring works differently)
32114.name: Merchants
boardgamepodcastepisode: Besprechung von Krallen und Fallen sowie Handelsfürsten-Herren der Meere

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
32116.description:
Description from publisher:

By cleverly combining the three colored dice with the values on the cards, you take part in building zeppelins and finally the famous Hindenburg.

Renè from spielbox.de:

"Giganten der Lüfte (working-title "Zeppelin") is a very tactical dice-game. You need mechanics, engines, and workshops.... Only the player with the best combination of those will successfully take part in building the Hindenburg."

Giganten der Lüfte is not comparable to Lucky Loop or Alhambra - the dice game.
It is comparable to games like Kingsburg and To Court the King, where you use the dice as a form of resources to manage, as well as a method of purchasing other resources.

Artwork by Jo Hartwig.


Microbadges:
32116.name: Airships
boardgamepodcastepisode: Besprechung von Giganten der Lüfte (Queen Games)

32117.description:
(From the publisher's web site:)

War on the Eastern Front engulfed small Axis satellites like a hungry wolf. None were spared. Hungarians, Romanians, Yugoslavs and Finns clashed with the Soviet giant and Nazi supermen, as well as one another in a senseless yet hellish struggle. Tanks of all marks, and outdated weaponry met the first futuristic MBTs as the miles and weeks ticked away until Gotterdämmerung in Berlin and the end of what was unleased with Barbarossa.

A collection of six maps, ranging in size from 24” x 36” to smaller sizes, are provided for use with the entire TOTAL AXIS PACK SERIES of scenarios. TOTAL AXIS PACK II will provide another batch of scenarios for use with the TAP map collection. Geomorphic boards are also used with TAP scenarios.

Ownership of Beyond Valor and Armies of Oblivion, are required to use this product. Ownership of Critical Hit's Jatkosota: Finland's Continuation War for ASL is also suggested.

Contents:
12 scenarios
6 maps on heavyweight stock
Variant Rules card
32117.name: Total Axis Pack I: Eastern Front Firestorm
boardgameexpansion: Jatkosota: Finland's Continuation War for ASL

32118.name: The Perfect Present
32118.description: The Perfect Present is a fun party game where players take turns being the gift receiver, and everyone else tries to give them a present they want the most. The player who is best at giving presents is the winner. This game has a similar feeling to Apples to Apples, and it's quite fun to get and give presents!

32120.name: Horse Racing To-night
32120.description:
An edition of the Pepys Board Game Series.

Game contains one large three-folded gameboard, 6 bakelite horses with jockeys (metal ones in a different edition) on wooden stands, 2 black and two red wooden dice, 2 bakelite dice shakers and three obstacles on wooden or metal wire stands (regarding how many horses start).

Players agree before play how long the racecourse they want to play. According to this the obstacle(s) are placed.
The dice are thrown, one showing which horse will move and the other how far this horse will ride.
Interesting rule is that always two dice-pairs are thrown simultaneously, speeding up play.
The obstacles do what they are designed for: Hinder a horses move.
It is advised that players place bets before commencing to play.

32121.description:
A very special game edited during the promotional campaign for the political elections in the German State of Hessen in 1978.

It was a giveaway of the political party of the CDU (Christian Democratic Union) trying to contain some humour against their main opposition, the SPD (Social-Democratic Party of Germany).

The game is a variant of Hoffmanns game JAG UND SCHLAG (Tally Ho).
Thus the rules a rather similar: All the cards are spread out randomly over the board, backside up.
Each player in turn turns a card over, no more altering its position on an ordinary square.
Each card depicts an arrow, in which direction this card can capture a weaker opponent, if possible.
Each card can travel along the lines as far as the player chooses.
Special rules: In the large cities of Hessen (yellow squares with a red border)the direction of the arrow can be altered.
The large cities can also be captured and if occupied at the end of the game count extra points printed on the board, in addition to each captured card during play.

Very good variant with the extra spice of the large city rules which make play very differently to Tally Ho.

Also an extra bonus: All the graphics are from Hoffmann himself !
32121.name: Das grosse Hessen-Spiel

32122.name: Spell
32122.description:
A word building card game from the Pepys card series.

Each card bears 2 letters (apart from 1 joker which bears the word "spell").
The cards are combined in pairs to form words which are changed constantly by covering the cards on the table with fresh cards.
This way you use always one half of the word (your choice)to build another new one.

Good to be played with adults and children together.

A variant allows to play this game as a patience.

3 editions known.

32123.name: Quizmo Multiplication Division
32123.description: An educational lotto game, featuring multiplication and division. Quizmo is a game that helps children understand and memorize the basic number facts in multiplication and division. It is played like Bingo. Cards are double sided, multiplication on one side, division on the other. Mark off answers to math problems on the card.

32124.description:
A "spot the difference" game for children aged three and above, with a various themes. The game board consists of twelve double-sided tiles (with different pictures on each side), arranged in three rows (horizon, river, field); the players look at the board and try to memorize it. Then they close their eyes while three of the tiles are flipped over. The players must find which tiles have been flipped over and say what the difference is. The first player to spot a difference correctly receives a pony token. The first player to collect four pony tokens wins the game.

Hide & Seek is a simple perception and memory game. It also trains concentration, and if the players are asked to describe the differences in detail it can also broaden vocabulary and aid fluency of speech.
boardgameversion: MB spellen Dutch Disney Princess edition
MB spellen Dutch Disney Winnie de Poeh edition
MB spellen Dutch My Little Pony edition
32124.name: My Little Pony Hide & Seek

boardgamehonor: 2008 Fairplay À la carte Winner
2008 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2011 Juego del Año Finalist
32125.description:
Who does not know the colloquial expression "Buying the cat in the sack" ("Buying a pig in a poke")? In this game you can experience the meaning of this expression yourself. A group of cats wants new owners, but these lucky people do not know if they get some sweet pussycats or one or more mean old cats. Sometimes only a dog is helpful, who chases the unwanted cats away. But then too many dogs are worse, too, because they only think about chasing themselves away. A clever auction game with many interesting decisions.

Idea of the game: With their mice, the players attempt to grab the famous cat in the sack. In the sack, there are both good and bad cats. Each player can also put a dog or rabbit into the sack instead of a cat, allowing players to bluff one another. At game end, all positive cats and mice count plus points, but negative cats count minus points.

Contents: 50 game cards, 4 mouse cards, 1 "cat in the sack" card, 1 start player marker, 76 mice money
32125.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET58: Imperios futuros y peste en las cloacas.
The Spiel #50 - It's In The Bag

32126.description:
Another one from the Pepys Double Feature Games series.

The game contains 17 gallop cards, 20 jump cards (4 each of 5 colours), 10 water jump cards (2 each of 5 colours), 4 fall cards and 4 whip cards.
Added is a paper playing mat enforced with raw canvas on the back and 5 cardboard horses on coloured wooden stands.
