In this horse racing card game players try to be the first past the post.
To achieve this they have to find the best moves with their hand of 5 cards.
This game is really tricky, as some cards allow only one horse of a certain colour to move and some other cards affect all horses.
As there are also several obstacles on the course which require certain cards to surmount you have to find the best moment when to play which card to move your horse and to hinder the others.

If you want, you can use a portion of the mat to place bets for the horses.
32126.name: Chase

32127.name: Rally 6
32127.description:
Rally 6 is more than just a car rally game but a spark to the imagination for all ages. The unique board design enables re-arrangement of the aerial view of the village of Whittlton to give six different layouts at varying levels of play.
No mid-game boredom with Rally 6. Driving through the village involves thrills and hazards, natural features such as fords, level crossings and junctions in addition to those brought about by landing on the yellow cross-hatched Incident squares. The game is always close run and maintains the excitement right to the end.
Choose and navigate your own route to pass through all ten checkpoints, encounter and overcome the hazards, re-adjust your route to deal with changing conditions and race home to win Rally 6. The thrills of Rally 6 are endless because no two games are ever the same.

32128.name: Wat ben ik?
32128.description:
From the box (translated from Dutch):
I am a person but I don't know who. What must I ask before I know?
A bag? No. A hat? And do I have something in my hand?
Am I wearing something blue? Am I in the countryside?
Am I the pilot? The cook? No, I must be the fireman!
But I must be sure before I look.

Which question shall I ask to get the right clue. Hurray! I've found it. Everything points out that I must be the nurse!

32129.name: Taktika
32129.description:
At its heart, Taktika is a serious game of strategy and skill. The main difference between Taktika and other strategy games is that you flick your pieces around the table to set up attack and defense. Each player has an army of ten wooden discs. There are 3 types of units and they all move and attack differently. Scenarios are available with the base set and on the publisher's site.

Official Blog: SkyCastleGames.Blogspot

32130.name: Tippa Speedway
32130.description:
Nice little family game from Sweden.

Players try to round the racetrack the fastest of all competitors.
Game is challenging for children and adults alike.
There are special rules for moving, falls, overtaking etc.
Event cards add the odd spice to gameplay.

At the end of a given time victory points are awarded.
If you play shorter games, a campaign can be played.

Excellent plastic game pawns !

32132.name: Little People Bingo
32132.description: The Little People Bingo is a Little People themed Bingo for children 3-6 played with cards with objects rather than balls with numbers. The boards have 2 sides: one with a grid of 6 objects (for younger children) and one with 6 objects in a scene (for older children). On top of that, there is a Little People figure (Eddy) which goes on your side each time you get a card. There are Eddy cards too. When they are drawn, the player with the Eddy figure on his side gets the Eddy card.

32133.name: MéliMélo
32133.description: MéliMélo is a game for children 3 and up. 10 cards with the bottom half on an insect are dealt to the players, and the cards with the matching halves make the draw pile. Cards are drawn one by one and players try to assemble the insects, which have names that rime, like (in french) Mireille l'abeille.

32134.name: Puzzlito
32134.description: Puzzlito is a circular jigsaw puzzle describing the activities of the day of Pompon the bear. Players try to find the pieces and place them in order. It's an educational game to teach children 3 and up the notion of time.

32135.name: The Friendly Farm Domino
32135.description: The Friendly Farm Domino (Domino de la ferme de Foin-Foin, in french) is a domino game for children 3 and up. Dominos have 2 sides: one with horseshoes (instead of dots), and one with farms animal (for younger children). It's played like regular dominos except the farmer is a wildcard (on the other side, there is no zero, but a star, which is also a wildcard).

32136.name: Bingo des images
32136.description: Bingo des images (french title) is a game for children 5 to 12 . Each player gets a board with a 5 x 6 grid. The top 5 square contain the letter of the word BINGO, and each of the others contain one of 6 images. There is one die with the letters of BINGO and one with the 6 images. Dices are rolled and players place tokens on the matching letter/images on their board. The first player with a line of 5 tokens (horizonal, vertical or diagonal) wins.

32137.name: Party Time
32137.description:
Party time is a dutch game from the Big Six series from Nova Carta.

You have to form two teams. Throw a coloured dice.

Every colour corresponds with a theme on a card.

Red- Say uuuhh
Player has to tell a story about the subject on the card without saying uh for 30 seconds

Blue- Pantomime
Player has to use pantomime to let his team guess the word on the card

Yellow- Illegal words
Player has to tell about the word on the card, but cannot name some words (shown on the card)

Green- No yes or no
The opponents get to ask questions about a subject on the card for 1 minute. The player may not answer with yes or no

Purple- Say what?
The player can mention the three underlined words on the card. His team has to guess the saying by these three words.

When a guess is correct, the team gets a chip with the corresponding colour. Collect all colours and your teams wins!

This is a light party game, suitable for players with a minimum age of 12.

32138.name: Conquer Everest
32138.description:
(From National Geographic's Store Website):

Retrace the National Geographic expedition that first put American climbers on the summit of Earth's highest mountain: the Himalaya's 29,035-foot-high Mount Everest. In this exploration and strategy game, actual photos of Everest create the playing surface. Use Skill and Gear cards to ascend a photo-realistic 3-D mountain via routes used by the real climbers, including National Geographic Society photographer Barry C. Bishop. But watch out because hazards are everywhere and can cost you your shot at the summit! For 2 to 4 players or teams, Ages 8 and up. National Geographic map of Everest included. 14W x 19L x 11H.

32139.name: Spider-Man 3 Wall Crawl Race Game
32139.description: This is a movie tie-in children's game. One player plays Venom, the other plays Spider Man. Each player is armed with a Spider-Man like webshooter that shoots a laser beam instead of webs. You aim the lazer beam at a dector attached to your character. If you aim the beam correctly, you character will begin to climb. First character to the top wins.

32140.description:
Another game of the scarce Pepys double feature series.

Game box contains 14 high speed cards, 14 low speed cards, 7 hazard cards (black letter) and 5 hazards (red letter).

For movement players use 6 car cards: Jaguar, Sunbeam Talbot, Riley, Bentley, MG and Ford Zephyr.

Added are 3 long card strips depicting various towns, scenes and check points along the route of the real Rally Monte Carlo.

Each player gets a hand of 4 cards.
In his turn, he can play a high speed or low speed card in order to move his car card 1 or only 1/2 length along the pictures of the movement strips.
If another player has layed out a movement card there is the possibility to lay a hazard card upon it.
The faster you travel the worser the hazards.
Play ceases at every check point, the later you come the more penalty points you score.
A new hand is dealt then.
After the last checkpoint game alters, the players have to fix for themselves if they want to travel high or low speed until they reach finish; no other card is then allowed.
After arrival at Monte Carlo a last point total is scored.

As with most Pepys card games the graphic artwork is astounding and adds to the atmosphere of the game. Nice little filler...
32140.name: Stirling Moss' Rally

32141.name: Puzzle Duel
32141.description:
Each players gets a puzzle-frame, 8 big pieces and 8 small pieces (one or two squares).
You put five big pieces into the frame. The empty spaces you fill up with the small pieces. Then you remove the big pieces. After that the players give each other their puzzle-frame and the five pieces. The first player that can put the five pieces back into the frame, wins the game.
To make it more difficult, you can give each other 8 pieces. In that case, you don't know which five to use.

32142.name: Salomon's Dilemma
32142.description:
From the box and homepage:

The trilogy is now complete! After the success of the DaVinci Code and Bernini Mystery games, Salomon's dilemma is now out.

Do you guess correctly or wrong?
Each player sets up their pieces on the table without revealing them to the other players. The object then is to figure out how the other players have arranged their pieces, and "taking them out". You are presented with some tough choices, and an acute sense of deduction is an absolute necessity.

Pick carefully, judge correctly and win the game!

Belongs to a series / trilogy, containing:

Bernini Mysterie
Coda
Salomon's Dilemma

32143.name: Kazaam
32143.description:
Soon a powerful alchemist will decide, who of his apprentices will explore the deepest secrets of his mysterious art and who will have to return home. A test awaits his students, who are faced with a task of creating an artificial living creature.

In Kazaam you take on a role of a novice alchemist trying to create his first very own homunculus. You have an opportunity to build a truly unique creature, made up of body parts of various elemental beings, for which you pay with magical alchemical ingredients. You best hurry, your competitors are already at work, and only the best alchemist’s apprentice can dream of a glorious career!

Home Page: https://www.wolffang.pl/KAZAAM-1.html

32144.name: It's News to Me!
32144.description:
From Back of Box:

With "It's News to Me!" the race is on to the editor's office in a new "unbored" game that has players pretending to be reporters on assignment. "It's News to Me!" sparks student imagination and interest in today's world. The game challenges students to complete tasks that incorporate every aspect of the Newspaper.

The ACTIVITY BOOK covers:
- What is a newspaper?
- Newspaper Terms
- Classroom Ideas
- The Front Page
- Headlines
- What makes it news?
- Where does the news come from?
- Editorials
- Editorial Cartoons
- Advertising in the newspaper
- This 'N That

These exercises introduce students to styles of writing, design, personalities in the news and world events. The activities include drawing conclusions, comparing points of view and decision making. Suitable for Grades 4 and higher.

32145.name: Komm wir rechnen
32145.description: Komm Wir Rechnen, or Come We Learn to Count, is an education game in which children learn mathmatics by placing equations onto the correct answer on a grid of numbers. When all the tiles are placed, they are turned over to reveal images, which, if all the answers are correct, will form a complete picture.

32146.description:
From the publisher.

You have finally landed the job of your dreams: Trailer Park Manager!
To be the Best Darn Trailer Park Manager in town, you must place quality Tenants in your trailers, create a fun and friendly atmosphere by adding some sweet Amenities, and go about destroying the other trailer parks
…no matter what it takes.

Surface to Trailer Missile? Molotov Beer Can? A Tornado? You Bet.

Game Contents:

100 Plastic Flamingo Miniatures
48 Trailer Cards
130 Trailer Park Wars Cards
24 Trailer Park Name Tiles
Instructions

The object of the game is to gain as many flamingos as you can. Flamingos represent points.

Each player arranges 12 trailers in front of them shaped like a clock. In the middle are randomized cards that represent the name of the player's trailer park. This has no effect on game play.

Players have seven cards to start. On each turn each player plays three cards, discards one and draw back up to seven. Each of the Trailer Park Wars cards are separated into one of 4 types:


Action Cards: can help the player or be used against an opponent.
Tenant Cards: with traits that include their job, age, what they can be placed near in your trailer park (for example an old man can't cannot be placed near a rock musician), also there is an icon depicting how many flamingos they are worth.
Amenities Cards: allow for more points when played.
Natural Disaster Cards: have a negative effect on an opposing player.


Once all the flamingos are gone, the player with the most flamingos wins.
32146.name: Trailer Park Wars
boardgameexpansion: Trailer Park Wars! Expansion: Terror in the Trailer Park

32147.name: Philmont: The Adventure Trail ... Game of Survival
32147.description: Philmont The adventure trail ... Game of Survival after standard roll and move, draw a card and answer for reward or penalty. Questions involve animal identification, backpacking and camping knowledge, and knots (Philmont is a Boy Scout camp). The goal of the game is to get a certain number of reward chips for answering questions correctly.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee
32148.name: BallCube
32148.description:
Who has the best strategy to get their marbles out of the BallCube? Who has worked out how the marbles will fall? In the end, all that counts is to block and open the slots with the pusher in order to get your marbles out as quickly as possible while hindering the movement of your opponent's marbles.

BallCube is a mind game for 2-4 people (teams), that encourages spatial thought, tactics and strategy.

Game contents: 1 gamebox (consisting of 8 elements), 27 marbles (8x black, 8x red, 2x white, 5x blue, 4x yellow), 2 sets of perforated pusher (each set with 12 pusher, whereby the number and positioning of the holes in each pusher are arranged differently.)

32149.name: Word Blur
32149.description:
In Word Blur, The object is to get your teammate(s) to shout out the mystery word (before your opponents) using only the word tiles as clues. 900 basic word tiles are spread out in the center of the table. One player on each team scrambles to find the word tiles that will best describe the mystery word to their teammate(s). Tension mounts as teams get closer and closer to the correct answer. All teams play every round so there are no down times like some games. This is a non-stop party game filled with hilarious guesses, creative clues that will challenge the way you think. Boxes measure 8"×5"×2" and weigh 2 pounds each. Game is for 3 or more players ages 10 & up.

Home Page: http://www.wordblur.com

32150.description:
Ambush Alley is a modern miniature wargame that allows players to recreate the intense counter-insurgency actions in an urban environment that have become the hallmark of 21st century warfare. The rules revolve around a universal mechanic that is easy to grasp but supports a high level of detail and rewards sound tactical play. The game’s dynamic turn sequence captures the turmoil of the modern city fight and integrated fog of war keeps things chaotic and unpredictable!

Ambush Alley contains complete rules for all the key elements of modern counter-insurgency and street-fighting, including:


Civilians on the Battlefield
Full Vehicle Rules
Special Assets and Off-Board Support
Night Combat
UAVs
IEDs and VBIEDs
Building Clearing
And much more!


Ambush Alley includes five scenarios and sample organizational charts for US, British, and Australian forces.

The game can be played at any scale from 15mm up. 15mm scenarios call for a 2’x2’ table, while 28mm games only require a 4’x4’ table.

Ambush Alley is easy on the pocketbook where miniatures are concerned. Few scenarios require more than ten figures for the Regular force and a dozen or so for the Insurgents.

Ambush Alley also offers full solo-play rules, so players can still have fun pushing their figures around the table even when a flesh and blood opponent isn’t available!

Expanded by:


Ambush Alley: Day of the Rangers (2008)
Ambush Alley: Motor Pool (2007)
INVALID OBJECT ID=33973, type=thing (2007)
Ambush Alley: The Three Block War (2008)
Ambush Alley: Art of War (2008)
Ambush Alley: Operation – Darkstar (2008)
Ambush Alley: Under the Black Flag (2008)
Ambush Alley: Lawyers, Guns & Money (2008)
Ambush Alley: Indian Country (2009)
The Wasteland (2010)
32150.name: Ambush Alley
boardgameexpansion: Ambush Alley: Day of the Rangers
Ambush Alley: The Three Block War
Ambush Alley: Under the Black Flag

32151.name: Bold Adventure
32151.description:
From back of box:

Three centuries ago, a man named John Bunyan wrote an adventure narrative called Pilgrims Progress that has captured the imagination Western Christendom like no other book since the Bible.

Rock Harbor Creations has now brought the dramatic highlights of that perennial bestseller vividly to life in an exciting new board game called Bold Adventure. Like the book's hero, Christian, you leave the City of Destruction behind on your way to the Cross, and ultimately to the Celestial City. Like him, you'll go slowly at first, using the lower numbers on the inner circle of the spinner (there are no dice). But once you reach the Cross and leave your burden there, again like him, you'll find your pace increases, as you shift to the higher numbers on the outer circle of the spinner.

Along the way, you'll meet Mr. Evangelist who'll warn you to avoid such perils as the Slough of Despond and Beelzebub's Castle, and beware the enticements of Vanity Fair. Once you've made your way past Doubting Castle, and Giant Despair, you get a glimpse of your destination from the peak Delectable Mountain.

Designed to appeal especially to youngsters, bold adventure is a fast playing game for two to six players, taking no more than 30 to 45 minutes per game, on the average. It is also easy to play; all you have to do is the old enough to read instructions and follow the directions on the board. And, it is fun to play: the game is designed so that the lead will change frequently, and no one will be left too far behind. There are also some interesting lessons to be learned in route. For instance, if someone else lands on your space, instead of him having to go back to the beginning (disease or sending you there), you, being a good pilgrim say, "Please go ahead of me," and he moves one space in front of you. Similarly, lest you get discouraged at how far ahead the others are, there are three squares along the way marked "The last shall be first" -- land on one of these, and you immediately move one space in front of the leader.

Nor are you necessarily the winner if you arrive at the last square first, for there is still the River of Death to cross. There are two ways to attempt that, as indicated on the River of Death cards in two random piles. Draw a card and see if you: ford the river and enter the Celestial City, or except the invitation of Captain Vain-hope, to avoid getting your feet wet, and let him ferry you across. Alas, if you choose the latter, his boat capsizes and you are swept down the river and over the falls into Perilous Pool. When you climb out, you'll find that you have a fair ways to go before you again attempt across the river.

The first player to ford the river wins, but all pilgrims may enter the Celestial City if they embark on the bold adventure set before them.

32153.name: Dungeon Builders
32153.description:
This piecepack game has two phases: First all the players build a dungeon by placing rooms, monsters and items. They may also use their turns to power their hero up, as only the most powerful hero will enter the dungeon.

When the dungeon is ready, the most powerful hero (in case of a tie, there's a small auction) enters the dungeon and plays a mini Dungeon Crawl, trying to get all the gold and defeat the monsters.

If the hero is successful, he'll keep the gold, but the other players will also gain gold for every point of damage done by their monsters and for items used.

The game is played in different rounds until one player gains a set amount of gold decided at the beginning.

There's an element of bluffing because items and monsters are placed face down, hiding their identity, and this can be used to trick other players.

32154.description: Down Under is a tile placing game where players place their tiles trying to increase their route. The player with the longest route at game end is the winner. As tiles also contain animals, players score or lose extra points for having groups of specific animals in their route.
32154.name: Down Under

32155.name: Safetyville
32155.description:
Playing the Safetyville Board Game is a great way to spend time with your children while teaching them important safety information. You too will learn some valuable safety information to help protect your children while they become more safety aware. Be the first player to get to school and become a Safety Graduate for the Day. Keep playing until everyone gets to school. Every player is a winner.

You advance by spinning for the color you will move to if you answer a safety question correctly. There are different skill levels on each card.

The game is approved by the VCA (Vanished Children's Alliance).

32156.name: Whitetrash Roundup!
32156.description:
Clearly described as a novelty game. A deck with 50 cards and rules for four sets of games. Each game has different strategies for either collecting or sticking other players with tacky hillbilly habits or collectibles, such as outhouses, double-wide trailers, CB radios, roadkill TV dinners, and mullets.


In Where's the Crap?, players compete to collect the most tacky knick-knacks.



You try to get rid of your trash in Ultimate Redneck.



In Trash Collector you win by accumulating the best garbage from your neighbors.



In Capture the Redneck, you try to become the biggest hillbilly.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Årets Spill Best Party Game Nominee
32157.name: The T-Shirt Game
boardgameversion: Buffalo Games edition without green shirt on the front
32157.description:
The T-Shirt Game is the fashionable party game "wear" funny matters! Create your own T-shirt by matching ridiculous slogans to outrageous images. To create these laughable masterpieces, the "judge plays a T-Shirt Card, while everyone else throws in the best Slogan Card. Whether it’s funny, to the point, irrelevant, or irreverent, if the "judge" likes it, you win points.

From the box: Match ridiculous slogans to outrageous images, and create your own zany t-shirts. So much fun, even monkeys* love to play!

(monkeys not included)




Similar mechanics as in Apples to Apples. Players take turns as "The Judge", while the other players match slogan cards to cartoon images on a t-shirt card. Winning matches score point cards with varying amounts. First one to 3000 points is the winner.

32158.description: Simple roll & move children's game in which the pawns are baby chicks.
32158.name: Little Chicks

32159.description:
Island War Deluxe is a squad-level game of skirmishes in the Pacific Theater of the Second World War. You control Squads of Japanese and Americans, tanks, machine-guns, flamethrowers, bombers, fighters and Leaders as you fight battles on Iwo Jima, Okinawa, Tarawa, and Guadacanal.

Each Island War Deluxe hex represents 25-40 meters of terrain, and the turns depict from a few seconds to several minutes of action. The counters represent single characters (Leaders), Squads of men, Weapon Teams, Support Weapons and various administrative markers.

Fun yet historically accurate and challenging scenarios designed by Mark H. Walker and Bill Wilder (HPS Simulation's Proud and Few), that include battles on Iwo Jima, Okinawa, and other desperate encounters. Tense action. Players can direct Banzai charges, infiltrate enemy positions, and stitch their opponents with flanking fire during melee.

Scenarios include:


Bloody Ridge: The 2/5 Marines try to fight off the Japanese 35th Infantry Brigade as they attack toward Henderson Field.
Nishi: A Sherman tank helps Marines clear a ridge, laced with caves, near the tip of Iwo Jima.
Taking the Wanna Ridge: Marines go cave busting near the southern edge of Okinawa.
In the Sun: A Marine patrol is ambushed. Can they escape massacre on the beaches of Guadalcanal? Research by Bill Wilder
Forerunner: Marines tighten the nose on Mt. Suribachi.
A Place Called Betio: The beaches of Tarawa. Hard fighting. Air support. Japanese and Marine tanks. Enough said. Bill Wilder
Healing Under Fire: Navy Corpsmen try to save Marine lives, as the Marines try to save the Navy Corspmen. Bill Wilder


Also available in Print-n-Play.
32159.name: PnP-LnL Island War Deluxe

32160.name: Forever Families
32160.description: Forever Families is an LDS game that is designed to teach the methods of researching family history for work in Mormon Temples. Players move around the board attempting to match "Archive Records" with "Ancestor Cards." The first player who is able to take seven "Cleared Names" to the temple is the winner.

32161.name: Wypas
32161.description:
Wypas (Flock) is a simple party game for 3 - 6 players. Every player plays a role of a shepherd, trying to trim as many sheep as possible. Player trimming the most valuable sheep wins the game.

The game contains the following components:

- 110 cards
- 1 victory track
- 6 pawns
- the rulebbok

32162.name: Wettfahrt im Blitzzug
32162.description:
Published circa 1955 (http://www.spielbox-online.de/indxtemp.html?/sbmain/ersatzs....).

Nice family game where you have to deliver the pre-dealt wooden chips onto the corresponding circles on the board.

At the same time you have to visit as much of the 36 cities (each one provided with a card)on the map as possible. These are of 3 different values regarding how large they are.

You have to watch out that your visits include 4 cities at the far east, south, north and west borders of the board and to avoid the already laid out green chips: If you travel by one you have to pick it up.

Game ends when all 36 cities have been visited or if a single player has delivered all his green chips and is in posession of at least 8 city cards.

Points are scored for each city card to its full value for the player, each green chip scores 2 and each border city not visited 10 points against the player.

32163.name: Blitz-Flug um die Erde
32163.description:
A roll-and-move game with some unusual aspects.

Before gameplay you have to fix two metal arcs into the gameboard so that they cross at the centre of the board.

Then you begin starting in Berlin to travel along the routes with a car, trying to reach the next airport first.
On the way you have to answer trivia questions of the regions and cities you touch, which can hinder or accelerate your voyage.
At the airports you change transport and start to move via airplane along the metal arcs. If planes pass each other, one uses the upside and the other the downside of the arc.
The next airport you change back to car.

Winner is the player to arrive back first in Berlin.

32164.description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2006/2007 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

Players hold the role of merchants involved in the commerce of spices with the East Indies in the XVII century. Each merchant is a member of a number of different Merchantile Companies: it is therefore important to achieve the best position in the hierarchies at the right time, when the profit from the expedition is divided among them, either by monopoly of a single company or by shares of different companies.

The same cards are used in three ways: to gain the control of a company on a certain harbour, to struggle for the status inside of a company, and finally as trade goods to collect to dispatch orders.

The game is the winner of the Best Unpublished Game contest of Lucca 2006.

The first limited edition has been published in form of a card game.

The current edition has been expanded with more rules and materials to become a board game, containing:

- 1 board
- 60 shipment cards
- 14 harbors
- 18 merchants
- 16 missions
- 5 company rank markers
- 5 summary cards
- pirate’s cove and pirate’s ship
32164.name: Borneo

32165.description:
Darjeeling has two main board areas. The first is an array of squares representing one, two or three half-crates of tea in four different varieties (colors). Each player has a marker which moves about in the array, picking up tea at the rate of one square per turn. There are simple rules governing movement in this array and the players compete for the desirable squares.

Eventually, several times per game, each player has enough squares of a single color to fit them together so that the half-crates all make whole crates. Now he can make a tea shipment. This pays off in victory points in three different ways. First, there is a "demand" award of up to 6 VP depending on how long it has been since anyone shipped this variety. Second, if the shipment was of at least four crates, there is a flat bonus of 1 VP per crate.

Third and most pivotally, there are VP that will be awarded at the beginning of the player's next and subsequent turns. Each tea shipment is represented with cubes of the player's color (not the tea variety color) on a sort of barge. The new shipment of tea is always placed, in the other of the two main board areas, at the top of a column of all the recent shipments (the number of total shipments varying with the number of players in the game), so that as more shipments are made, the old shipments drift farther down the column and eventually out of play. At the beginning of your turn, you look to see where your shipments are in this column, and they pay out VP with better multipliers the higher they still are in the column. This constitutes the driving force of the game, as nobody else wants to see your shipment at the top of the column for several turns in a row. Players thus have an incentive to make a shipment even if they haven't yet assembled a large number of crates.

It's a race to 100 points. A runaway leader can easily take over if the rest of the table is not vigilant, so the best games of Darjeeling are those among vigilant players.
32165.name: Darjeeling

32166.name: Wizardology: Spells and Potions
32166.description:
From the back of the game:

"Unleash your Wizardology skills to become Master Wizard in Spells and Potions, the Wizardology Card Game. Use amulets, spells, and potions to find out who is the most powerful wizard of all. Team up with another wizard to collect the most points and win the game - magic!"

Spells and Potions is a partnership trick-taking game played with a deck of cards ranked 1 to 10 in four suits (representing the four elements, of which Fire is trump). There are also 12 Spells and Potions cards which change the rules of the game in various ways.

32168.name: Battle of the Atlantic: The Epic Struggle of the Wolf Pack vs Convoy
32168.description: The game is a simulation of the World War II Battle of the Atlantic between Germany against Britain and the US. The game scale covers the entire Atlantic ocean from England to the US East Coast and from Greenland to South America. The game is strategic in nature but it includes U-boats, surface raiders and aircraft on an individual ship scale. The campaign game can be picked up and played to completion from multiple points in time.

32169.name: The Hawaii Game
32169.description: Race your sailboat through the Hawaiian Islands! Be the first to win the ract to the finish! Can you accept the risks? You could be dismasted? You could find yourself bacalmed...you could sail into a hurricane! But then again you could see a double rainbow and gain an extra turn, or race ahead of pirates to the next port of call. To win, you must be the first player to sail through the warm Hawaiian waters to the finish, and collect 5,000 points during the trip.

32170.name: Pass auf, kleine Maus!
32170.description:
The playing board shows 12*16 tiles. Most of them show a piece of cheese, or sometimes a cat. On 6 tiles there is an image of six different sweets (cake, ice cream, ...). At last there is one starttile.
There are also 18 cardboard pieces with 3 times the 6 different sweets.
The last part of the game is a cardboard square with in the middle of it a hole. This is the mousecard.
The first player moves the hole of the mousecard accross the starttile. The first of the 18 sweets is revealed. Now the player moves the mousecard accross the board in the direction of the same sweet as shown on the board. At every tile passed he verifies the nature of the tile. If it is a piece of chees then he continues. But if the cat appears the turn goes to the next player. When at last the tile with the same sweet appears the player on turn receives the sweet.
Now the next sweet is revealed and the game continues.
The player winning 4 sweets wins the game.

32171.name: El Club de los Martes
32171.description:
The Tuesday Club Murders (El Club de los Martes) is formed when the host, is entertaining friends and they decide that each should tell a story of a mystery, without revealing the answer, so that the others can try to guess the outcome. It is felt that with their combined skills and variety of individual experience, they will be able to solve the problems presented. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.


=======

How would it be if we formed a Club? What is today ? Tuesday? We will call it The Tuesday Night Club. It is to meet every week, and each member in turn has to propound a problem. Some mystery of which they have personal knowledge, and to which, of course, they know the answer. Let me see, how many are we? One, two, three, four, five. We ought really to be six... (Joyce Lempriére)

From this conversation in Agatha Christie’s book ‘The Tuesday Club Murders’, a series of great detective stories come up, where perceptive characters rival Miss Marple, who teachs them a real lesson of shrewdness, explaining with talent and with all kind of misteries, no matter how strange or complicated they may be.

This game is exactly that: a narrative game based on the classic detective stories. A group of five players cooperate and compete to solve a mistery proposed by a sixth player, known as the host, trying to emulate Sherlock Holmes himself, from Arthur Conan Doyle’s books. Host and players find themselves entwined in a complicated game of cat and mouse, where the first one propose a mysterious enigma and the others must solve it by racking their brains. For a length of an hour, as that is the time limit to solve the mistery, an intense (intellectual) battle is fought, where the host challenges the rest of the members of the Tuesday Club to find a solution that almost never is near or within reach. The armchair detectives will have to use in a creative way the clichés with which their dramatic characters have been defined, and they will have to make the appropriate questions in order to find the solution.

Therefore, this is a game that puts the perceptiveness, intuition, and above all the logical and deductive intelligence of the participants to test. The constant interactivity among the players, the creation of intelligent questions with shrewdness, wit and creativity, and the dynamism of the intrigue make ‘El Club de los Martes’ a perfect game to spend an hour of fun with family or friends.

El Club de los Martes is many games in one.


=======

A narrative game of deduction and logic. All players are armchair detectives meeting every Tuesday to engage on some crime solving. A host presents the case and in turns each player can ask questions and use his or her special abilities to gather more information. Asking questions and gathering information cost money -every player starts the game with 15 pounds - paid to a common pool. Proposing a solution is very expensive and other players may benefit economically from you failures. Only one player may win, but the solution relies on the information gathered by the whole group with certain cooperatives aspects. If no detective solves the crime after one hour, nobody wins. The player with the “first player” token has the advantage because she starts every round; but if that player passes, she loses the token that goes to the next player.

Based in novel "The Tuesday Club Murders" by Agatha Christie.

Rules one are available in Spanish language.

32172.name: Fort Apache
32172.description:
One of the first wargames published by NAC in Spain, and one of its easiest too. Straight basic wargame perfect for beginners. Players represent four groups (American, Mexican, Indians and Horse Thieves) which fights for the control of an imaginary territory of the Far West.

Contents were:
-64x80 cms. mapboard
-counters
-1 plastic bag for the counters
-1 special die (without "1" and "6")
-Rulebook

Number of players: 2-4
Playing time: 120 min. approx.
Difficulty: easy

32173.description:
This game covers the Malayan campaign from 8 Dec 41 to the fall of Singapore in Feb 1942.
The map covers the Malayan peninsula. There appears to be 8 turns in the game, of which 1 turn equals approximately 1 week. Units are of battalion/regiment size.

Published in Command Magazine Japan # 77 on 20 Oct 07.
32173.name: Malaya '41: The Fall of Singapore

32174.name: Julemandsspillet
32174.description:
Lots of Christmass fun and exitement!

Who is going to be the Santa of the future. Be the first to solve the X-Mas mission for Sants and you will win the game. But watch out for the fake Santas.

Big game in a roll, ideal for X-Mas and the whole family.

32175.name: Drew Pearson's Predict-a-Word
32175.description:
Drew Pearson was a radio personality in the 1940s United States who had a segment on his show where he predicted upcoming events in politics and current affairs. This game was apparently created to market the show through the public's association of Drew Pearson with predictions.

The game is played by first spinning a spinner to decide which letter of the alphabet will go in the top left corner of a 5x5 square grid. The players then, in turn, call a letter to fill in the rest of the grid, one letter at a time. Each player has their own grid, and places the called letter on their grid without seeing where the calling player has placed theirs. Hence the 'prediction' - players must 'predict' what word the calling player is trying to build in order to know where to place the letters being called.

The game includes a rule booklet including a list of helpful words, a spinner, and a pad of blank 5x5 charts.

32176.name: Kletterbaum
32176.description:
A dice rolling game of isolation.

On the large, 10 x 6 squares measuring playing surface, 60 colour coded cards are spread out, showing the backside with 6 different coloured circles.

Players beging to move their pawns from the bottom of the board, digging their way into the cards.
If the colour on the die is the same as on an adjacent card, you can take the card and move on as long as you can pick up a card.
If you succeed to isolate a certain number of cards against the borders of the board, you can take them all.

On the front of the cards several 2-part pictures are depicted, winner is the player who is able to fix together the most complete pictures.

32178.name: Red Caboose
32178.description:
(From the back of the box)
Join the Engine, the Red Caboose and their circus friends as they make their way from the station to the Big Top. Roll the dice to find out who moves. Whoever makes it to the Big Top first, wins!

Comes with 1 Die, 1 Game Board, 6 Playing Pieces: 1 Engine, 1 Red Caboose, and 4 Passenger Cars

32179.name: Exodus From Egypt
32179.description:
Box back:

When you move your two pieces across the River Jordan into the Promised Land you WIN! Spectacular images light the path of the Israelites’ epic journey in the Exodus.

On your turn you will draw a card and play a card. Some cards give you a choice of possible moves, but what really adds to the number of possible moves is that you can move any piece on the board.

32180.name: The Dogs
32180.description:
A greyhound racing and betting game.

It consists of 46 cards:

6 cards showing traps
8x greyhound No.1
8x No.2
7x No.3
6x No.4
5x No.5
5x No.6
1x disqualified




Game itself is fairly simple: The traps are laid out one above the other, bets are placed on them.
The stack is shuffled well, and one card after another is turned up slowly and laid out along its trap card. Winner is the dog which has 5 turned up cards along its trap.
As there are different number of cards for each dog the odds are fixed accordingly, so that you can make the most money with dogs no.5 and 6.
If the "Disqualified" card turns up it is laid above the trap cards: If a dog has 5 cards counting for it this one is disqualified; winner is the next in line.

32181.name: Robin Hood
32181.description:
Game based on the popular British television series.

It consists of 44 cards in 11 suits, so there are 4 of each suit.

Winner is the player to get rid first of his dealt out cards.

First player lays out a card face down onto the table and calls out the number, next player in line must play the following number. After card no. 11 card no.1 follows.
At any time the card layer can be challenged: If the number challenged is correct, the challenger takes all his cards and those of the opponent, if not: it's just the opposite.
If the game tends to drag on, it is advised to fix a time limit.

Again a card game in line of the Pepys series with top graphic design and card quality.

32182.name: Mystic Egyptian Tomb
32182.description:
From the back of the box:

Dig and find the treasures buried in the mysterious egyptian tomb. Play a treasure hunting board game with the game sheet, and checkers dug out from the treasure. It's exciting. it's cool.

Contains a plaster block with treasures buried inside, specially designed digging tool, a game sheet (420mm x 594mm) where you play you adnenture game, checkers and dice included (to be dug out from the plaster block). Rules of the game are printed on the game sheet. Game for 2 to 4 players. Treasures include: Egyptian cat model, mummy case, Ankh-symbol of life, winged necklace, Egyptian symbol plates.

32183.description:
The game posits a destablisation of relations between Japan and its neighbours leading to conflict. The A1-size map spans from the southern tip of the Sakhalin Islands to the northern tip of Luzon. The game focuses on air and naval combat, with units representing individual ships and squadrons of aircraft. The USA, Japan, China, Taiwan, the two Koreas and Russia are represented in this game.

The game comes with three introductory scenarios:
- The Hunt for Chinese Han Class
- They met at Tsushima
- Battle over Kadena

And 6 full scenarios：
- Sink the Dokto
- Oil Field Waters
- Target Nodong
- Invasion Taiwan
- Fire in the Far East
- Two Against Japan
32183.name: Asian Fleet

32184.name: Prison Break
32184.description:
In this (French) game you will incarnate Michael Scofield or one of his fellow captives. Of course you will put all your efforts into escaping from Fox River Prison.
Demonstrate speed and strategy, because at the end of first phase of the game called “recruitment of allies", you may be eliminated from the team and you will be designated to represent the character of Sergeant Bellick instead.
Reflexion, co-operation and persuasion will be your assets to be able to escape without being caught by Sergeant Bellick who wants his revenge…

The game consists of:
- 1 map
- 8 pawns of personage
- 78 eventcards (chance, handicap)
- 34 chips guards
- 27 chips tools
- 1 die

32185.name: Figuro
32185.description:
A game from the main creative period from Rudi Hoffmann.

Each player gets a figure (hence the name of the game), made of 4 tiles.
All the tiles are shuffled before game begins and are spread out over the orange squares of the 7 x 7 squares playing zone of the gameboard.
After the tiles have been turned up the players try to reunite the complete figure.
Alternately the single tiles are drawn as far as the player chooses vertically or horizontically.
When 2 or more tiles have been reunited, they draw as one.

Winner is the player who has completed his figure first.

The graphics are as usual in this period from Hoffmann himself.

boardgameimplementation: Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge
32186.description:
Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge - Gold Edition is a substantial reworking of the game that originally appeared in the Armchair General. Counters represent the brigades, leaders, and batteries that Lee at Gettysburg... Lock n Load Publishing fought on the first day of the Gettysburg. Leaders are critical not only rallying their troops, but enhancing their attacks as well.

New in the Gold Edition are facing rules, enhanced leader capabilities, retreats that can route an entire line of troops, and a completely new layout of the rules, charts, and scenarios. And speaking of scenarios, Gold Edition revises one of the original scenarios and adds two more, bringing the Gold Edition scenario total to four.

Re-implements:

Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge
32186.name: Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge (Gold Edition)

32187.description: Chaoty the Pixie is at it again messing up the kids' room! Players must clean up the messy kids' room by flipping cards to find a match. Who will be the quickest to spot the right objects? A game of quick reactions for ages 4 and up.
32187.name: Chaos in the Kids' Room

32189.name: Denver in a Box
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
32189.description: Denver in a Box is a Monopoly clone focusing on the city of Denver. Squares and cards have information relevant to the city.

32190.name: Go Ahead, Little Loc!
32190.description:
An enjoyable dice game for the whole family.

Little wooden locos try to find the fastest way from the station of "Hinterstein" to the destination station of "Moosbach".

In order to achieve this the players throw two dice.
6 crossings on the board are covered with special switch tiles, each one fixed to a roll of doubles.
A seventh card is also provided.
If a player rolls a double, he can exchange the switch card with the seventh card, turning it as he likes.
Some places and cards have a stop bar printed on them.
If a loco rams a bar, it is turned 180 degrees, now proceeding in the opposite direction. The player also now has the right to turn any of the 6 switches on the board as he chooses to do.
Play can become tricky, as it is possible to be captured in an endless loop where relief only comes with the roll of a double.

Fun for gamers of every age, superb artwork of the board add to the flair of the game.

32191.name: Spooky Scary Math Games
32191.description:
This 2001 sequel to Spooky Math Games is packaged as a thin staple bound book with 5 glow in the dark dice. The book presents a collection of 14 dice rolling games, each with a strong basis in math and each with a kid-friendly spooky theme.

Concepts covered in the games include basic arithmetic, fractions and simple probability.

The games in this volume are:


Roll the Bones
Poltergeist
Snake Eyes
Tiptoe Through the Tombstones
Secret Potion
Insect Attack
Quicksand
GHOST
E.S.P.
Grim Reaper
Stroke of Midnight
Into the Basement
Bats in the Attic
Caught in the Web


Predecessor:

Spooky Math Games

32192.description: Davey Jones' Locker is an historical miniature wargame set in the colonial era. Both naval and land battles can be fougth from the war of spanish succession (1588) to the crimean war (1850). Allows armies of any size and composition.
32192.name: Davey Jones' Locker

32193.name: Das Reiniger Spiel
32193.description:
Extraordinary equipped game from the sixties, even in German player circles scarce and obscure.

Game consists among others of: 3 grey factories, 10 red advertisement pillars with ads from the time produced, 10 brown laundry company headquarters, 15 orange franchise houses, 15 white drop-by stations, 150 ! chimneys in 6 player colours and much more!
All these are made of wood, the small houses have all holes drilled into where the chimneys can be fixed to mark the owner!

Aim of the game is to build a laundry imperium (the RÖVER company for which this game was made as promo was once the largest one in Germany) in order to attract the most customers of all players.
Extremly tricky is the fact that there are only 3 factories for 6 players, so first come, first serve...
But if you don't succeed, all is not lost!

Must be one of the most beautiful and playable roll-and-move games, still much decision making involved.

32194.name: Saba: Palast der Königin
32194.description:
Saba - the bead of the desert, legendary realm in the Orient.
It's the 9th century in the Kingdom of Saba, the region, that is the Republic of Yemen today.

One day, you are called to the courtyard of the mysterious Queen of Saba. As one of her advisors you are to create her a palace of singular splendour. Intelligently provide for supply of building materials, develop the perfect palace from alabaster and ebony and prevail skillfully against your competitors. Because only the best of her advisors will take his place besides the Queen of Saba as her new Grand Vizier .....

Players use the materials available at the harbor to expand the queen's palace and enjoy her favor. All your efforts have been in vain, though, the moment another contender surpasses you with a more impressive building in the same palace destrict. Will you be the one in front at the decisive moment ?

The game contains a three-dimensional palace (made of cardboard plugged together) on which the players' figures are placed.

32195.name: Story Chasers
32195.description:
Each player assumes the role of a Bible hero. Each hero has five cards that tell their story. If you can collect all five cards, you win.

At the start of the game, the story cards are placed face down in a circle which acts as a game board that your character cards move around on. On your turn, you draw a card and move as the card says to do. If you stop on a face down card, flip it over. If it is one of your character's story cards, you keep it and replace it with the movement card; if not, discard the movement card.

32196.name: Say What?
32196.description: Say What is an electronic game where the object is to unjumble famous phrases or lyrics by switching lighted modules while being timed. Each round the time gets lower. After each try the game tells you the order your words are in and how many are still out of order.

32197.name: GoraKhpoR
32197.description:
Gorakhpor is a two dimensional game of strategy using a draughts-like set up but requiring the mind set of a chess player. To win, you must be the first to form a straight and continuous line linking four points on the board.

The word 'gorakhpor' means "Go to a waiting room!"

When the game is played according to the 3 quickly and easily learnt rules, families, friends and strangers are brought comfortably together.

32198.name: Chip 'n' Dale Nuts! Game
32198.description:
This is from the rules:

The goal of the game is to collect the most nuts.

Each player at his (or her) turn spins the spinner, then moves the Chip 'N' Dale playing piece, from tree to tree, clockwise around the game board according to the number spun.
When a player lands on a tree which contains no nuts, he takes nuts -- according to the number spun -- from the center of the game board and places them on the tree where he landed. For example, a player who spins 3, moves three spaces, and if the tree where he lands has no nuts, takes three nuts from the center of the game board and places them on that tree. If, however, a player lands on a tree already containing nuts, he removes all the nuts from that tree and places them off the game board on the table in front of him. His turn ends.
Play continues in this way and tell no nights are left on the center of the game board. Game ends as soon as the last nut is taken from the center of the game board.
Winner is a player with the most nuts on the table in front of him.

32199.name: The Major Matt Mason Space Exploration Game
32199.description:
Comment from Keith Meyer's site:

" If a kid wasn't satisfied with the ever increasing popularity of the Major Matt Mason toy line, and just couldn't get enough of the toys themselves or the compliment of non-toy items such as note book binders, wallets, puzzles, etc.... There was this really cool looking boardgame! Not a great game, but hey, it's Major Matt Mason so we had to love it!.

The object of play was to explore the moon for signs of life. The first explorer who returns to the space ship and is able to point out where there are three signs of life-- as shown by the moon cards--is the winner.
"

Keith Meyer's MMM collector's site entry:
http://www.majormattmason.net/5453.htm

32200.name: Seadogs and Darlings
32200.description:
Seadogs and Darlings is a social climbing game akin to En Garde! There is no duelling in the game and a greater emphasis on entertainments and events to try to gain a better position in life. You may start life as a lowly bakers boy or be the son of a count, you still will be of little consequence until you have made your mark as a socialite.

Diverse entertainments include, playwriting, cricket, bowling, carousing, joining the muster, joining the army and of course holding parties.

32201.description: The devil's in the details, and apparently, maybe in you too! From Toy Vault comes Possession, a deceptively fun party game that lets you battle the onslaught of the demon called Legion. As the weeks roll past you must use your wits and special talents to keep Legion's evil essence from spreading throughout the group. With Holy Men, the Parishioners, and the outcast Shamans, you stand in the path of evil, preventing the One Who Is Many from gaining the power needed to bring forth his demonic gathering.
32201.name: Possession

32203.name: Makahit
32203.description:
This could as well be an unknown prototype.

There are many handmade components with the game, but also many professional produced, such as the game board or the play money.

Each player moves his token around the board, to his choice by the throw on one die or two dice.
There are switches where to decide which way to follow.
Moving along players discover stars and songs and combine them to make a hit ("MAKAHIT").
With these they challenge for a place in the top ten in order to make money.
The money enables a player to buy gold discs, and the first to buy 5 gold discs is the winner of the game.

In the time intended to be released, the game could have been a hit. But as the author mentions in the professional produced rules: "Owing to legal difficulties it is not possible to print the actual names of stars and songs on the cards."

32204.name: Draw It Outloud
32204.description:
"Helping children and families express concerns and feelings of grief"

A therapeutic tool for professionals, a game used by family therapists and bereavment councilors to help kids in the grieving process after the death of a loved one.

32205.description:
A game about the battle of Ostroleka (May 26th, 1831) which was the turning point of the Russo-Polish War (November Uprising).

Also included are the counters and scenarios dealing with the Napoleonic battle of Ostroleka (February 15th-16th, 1807) between the French and the Russians.

The game is the herald of the new "Napoleonic" system designed for Taktyka i Strategia's games, dealing with medium and large battles of the Napoleonic Wars and the Russo-Polish War of 1831. Counters represent entire regiments, one hex represents 250m, one turn represents 30 minutes.

At present rules and all publications about the game are only in Polish language.
32205.name: Ostroleka 1831

32206.name: Jabberwocky
32206.description:
Players try to uncover the hidden Wild Word and to trick players into thinking that you hide the Wild Word.

Players write anything they want - a blurb or short story as the timer permits to either hide the Wild Word, or to fool other players into thinking your story contains the Wild Word.

32207.name: Natural History Lotto
32207.description: An early children's version of lotto or bingo in which the tiles drawn feature a variety of colorful animals.

32208.name: Mafioso
32208.description:
This game is the predecessor of the well known game The Mob/Capone.

It was first time presented 1987 at the legendary "death row" of the London Toys and Games Fair.

Game components are of a very high standard regarding there were only few copies released: 4 x 8 large wooden and brightly colored discs, each depicting another different family member and -car with a colored sticker fixed to it,32 wooden hood pieces (German "Poeppel"), 56 colored racket cards, 40 gold bars (bankroll chips), a lot of play money and a large, colorful gameboard with comic-like drawings.

Added is a Mafia book containing the stories of real family members in the year of 1931, fixed with the some drawings you find on the member discs.

Game-play is nearly the same as in The Mob: Many cards for only some places to conquer, but nobody knows how much are at the same time in play!
Possibilities to invest in legal businesses or to send an opponent to the fishes (cement boots are replaced by an offer from the Colt Company which you can't refuse...)are also presented.

Players are on the run for the gold bars and to be the first to amass 10 of them!

Re-implemented by:

The Mob

32209.name: The Crazy Gift Game
32209.description:
From the designers homepage:

The Crazy Gift Game, a true party game! Have all your guests bring one or more small, big, funny, strange and crazy gifts and play The Crazy Gift Game to see who ends up with the most gifts in the end!

Let the cards send the gifts to one and then another person! See the Lucky Lot go and disappear - and maybe grow again! A whole new kind of party game!

The Crazy Gift Game can be used at parties of up to 15 participants. For more participants: simply add a set of Crazy Gift Game cards. 1 set extra for up to 30 and two sets for up to 50 participants!

32210.name: Secret Agent: The Card Game With the Magic Monocle
32210.description:
The Pepys card game with the legendary magic monocle.

Game consists of 39 cards; 4 master agents, 5 secret agents, 5 secret plans, 5 inns, 5 trains, 5 planes, 5 cars and 5 M.T.B cards (and the monocle, of course...).

Object of the game is collect six cards:1 secret agent, 1 secret plan, an inn and 3 of the same kind of transport.
This is done by pick-up-and-discard.
In order to win none of these cards may have a secret message written on it.

If a player has collected the complete set he can call for help of the Master Agent (MA), thus using the magic monocle to reveal if any of his cards has a secret message written on it: He spreads them out and checks the colour coded strips at the base of his cards.

If there is none, he wins, if there is - play commences, now knowing which cards to discard.

As with nearly all Pepys games outstanding graphic design, the Monocle a really nice gimmick.

32211.name: Bible Story Lotto
32211.description:
Bible Story Lotto. For ages 3+
"Have fun matching the right pictures to the right game board."

Players take turns flipping tiles over. The visible tile is matched to the story on one of the player's game boards. The player who is first to fill his board wins. Contents: 24 tiles and 4 story cards with the tile collection spots on one side and the Bible story on the other side.

32212.name: Mind Your Manners
32212.description:
Mind Your Manners

(from the front of the box) -
This fun and informative board game will help you to stop wrestling with artichokes and start putting your best fork forward...for children, teenagers and adults.

Includes a special section on business etiquette for adults.

(and from the back of the box) -
From "which fork to use" to "how to make proper introductions," MIND YOUR MANNERS is the first board game of protocol and etiquette.

What a fun way for children, teens, adults and those on the corporate climb to be more at ease in social and business situations with table and telephone manners, restaurant etiqueete, greetings and introductions, international protocol and much more!!!

32213.description:
You are about to experience a journey of epic proportions. The world has changed. The polar ice is all gone and every major city that had a harbor before the Great Melt has vanished. You organize and rebuild your home-land. You assemble exploratory fleets as rumors of a green
Antarctica abound. Tremendous storms and other continental survivors cross your path.

If you prevail the prize, ‘Antarctica,’ is yours.

REBUILD YOUR NATION, BREACH THE STORMS, SEIZE ANTARCTICA
SURVIVE GLOBAL WARMING!
32213.name: Antarctica (second edition)

32214.name: Nowe Zagadki Smoka Obiboka
32214.description:
"New Riddles of Lazybones the Dragon" - as the title translates to English - is a sequel of Zagadki Smoka Obiboka, based on the same rules as the first part.

It is a children trivia game. It contains 135 new cards with rhymed riddles on one side and pictures showing the answer on the other. For correct answers players get tokens with appropriate drawings on. The owner of most tokens wins.

The cards from both games can be mixed together.

Predecessor:

Zagadki Smoka Obiboka

32215.name: Planes Game
32215.description:
Trick-taking card game of the Pepys Series Card Games, as usual well produced and designed.

Game consists of 44 cards: 12 class cards, 2 helicopter cards and 30 trio cards(depicting various planes in different classes and point value).

Object of the game is to win cards with tricks.
After dealing out the hand further cards are turned up until a class card appears. Players then choose 3 cards from their hands which they believe give a good point value vs. the class.
The packs are revealed simultaneously, winner of the trick is the one with the most point value (helicopters belonging to every class).
The winner also takes all the cards exposed by the other players depicting the class.
When the last class card has been played for the game ends and all the tricks are valued with a special count score.

Gameplay is the same as in the CAR GAME and GIRL from the same publisher.

32216.name: Pandas' Party
32216.description:
Unusual game from the Pepys Card Game Series.

It consists of 54 playing cards and two key cards.

The 54 cards can be laid out to complete a large puzzle picture containing 9 x 6 cards.

All cards are dealt out, the player with the letter card "F" begins play by laying out this card. Next player in line tries to add a fitting card to it and so on.

Winner is the player getting rid of all his cards first.
Other players receive penalty points for cards left in their hands.
After reaching a points limit agreed beforehand play ends.

You can see the wartime production by the grey and thick card quality and the not-so-glossy-graphics, but still top !

32217.description:
An expansion for ASL. 8 scenarios featuring desert warfare from December 1940 to November 1942.

This features German, Italian, British, Indian, French and New Zealand forces.

These scenarios use boards 25-29.

The scenarios are:

1) The Italians Need Help: Camp Tumar Wes, SOuth of Sidi Barani, Egypt - December 9, 1940
2) Tobruk Derby: South of Mechili Libya - April 5, 1941
3) Hellfire Pass: Halfay Pass, South of Sollum, Egypt - June 16, 1941
4) Seizing Sidi Rezegh: Near Sidi Rezegh, Libya - November 22, 1941
5) The French Fight: Bir Hachiem, Libya - June 9th 1942
6) Killing Field: Knightsbridge, South of Bir Lefa, Libya - June 12, 1942
7) Devil's Garden: South of El Alamein, Egypt - October 24, 1942
8) Supercharge!: South of El Alamein Egypt - November 2, 1942

This is not a complete game. Ownership of ASL modules is required.
32217.name: Desert Rats

32218.description:
First in a series of expansion packs by Critical Hit, this pack was actually designed by SS-Bar Enterprises and was distributed by Critical Hit.

This features 13 Pacific scenarios between the Japanese and the US Marines covering the period between August 21, 1942 and May 13 1945. The fighting covers Guadalcanal, the Solomon Islands, Aparmama Atoll, Tarawa Atoll, Saipan, Marianas, Guam and Okinawa.
32218.name: Leatherneck

32219.name: The Book of Mormon Card Game
32219.description:
The Book of Mormon Card Game is an LDS variation on Go Fish. Cards are numbered 1-13, with each number representing a book from the Book of Mormon. (The books of Enos, Jarom, and Omni are combined onto one card.) There are also four suits, Beehives, Buffalo Skulls, Seagulls, and Wagon Wheels. Players ask others for the cards they need to complete the "Books" by asking either for the name of the prophet pictured on the card (for children) or by quoting a scripture on the card (for advanced players).

The rules make note that this deck of cards is appropriate for other standard card games as well.

32220.name: Dinosaur Dominoes
32220.description: This is a Ravensburger game for 2-6 players, ages 4-8. The game utilizes 28 domino-like cardboard tiles as game components, with the tiles having pictures of 7 different types of dinosaurs. There are variant rule sets for different types of domino games, as well as educational material included about the different types of dinosaurs depicted on the tiles.

32221.name: Zug um Zug
32221.description:
Game consists of 120 cards, depicting 12 different train wagons.

Cardbacks show a steam locomotive.
Players try to put together trains consisting of the same sort of wagons.
Each wagon can be used as loco.
If it is a players turn, he can choose to draw 2 cards from the hidden stockpile or 1 card from the open drawpile.
Game can be ended by the player who has at least a train with 5 wagons and all other laid out with at least 3 wagons.

Trains count from the third wagon onwards, from the sixth double points.

If all this sounds familiar to anyone...(look at Express Card game by Mayfair Games!)

32222.name: Deer Hunter 2050
32222.description: In this future scenario, you play a hunter trying to bring his/her quota of mutant deer back to the Fish & Game Bureau first. Players alternate moving their hunter pawn and a random deer pawn. Cards are drawn depending on certain movement rolls that aid or hinder players. When moving deer, players can move them toward their hunter, away from other hunters, or to another hunter and roll to attack the hunter and send him/her to the hospital. Rolls also determine the success of hunters' attacks on deer.

32223.name: Zombie Attack
32223.description:
You have been locked into an old deserted mansion with six zombies! Can you find a key to escape before the zombies catch you and turn you into a zombie too?

Each player moves one human player and a random zombie each turn, using hiding places to avoid the zombies, weapons to eliminate them from the game, and keys to escape and win the game. Every time you play, nothing is in the same place as before. If you get caught by the zombies, your objective changes from escaping to stopping the other players from escaping.

32224.name: 4th Corner
32224.description:
As the maze expands, can you be the first to reach the exit? Players start in the middle of a maze. Every turn a player picks a tile and connects it with the tiles already on the table and then moves his/her pawn if desired or possible. Players attempt to keep their paths open and to block or trap their opponents with strategic placement of the wall tiles. After the fourth exterior corner tile has been placed, tiles may be replaced as well as placed, and the exit tile is shuffled into the draw pile. The first player to the exit tile when it appears scores zero points. Every other player gets points depending on how far their pawn is when the exit is reached by anyone. The fewest points after a number of rounds is the winner.

The only board game to receive the Top Toy 2008 award from Toy Directory Monthly! (See link below)

Note: If playing with only two players, try giving each player two pawns to move.

Received award for Best Vacation Toys 2009 from Dr. Toy.

32225.name: The Chat-Up Board Game
32225.description:
This chat-up game for all the family is just what sweet talkers everywhere have been waiting for !

Anytime, anyplace, anywhere you can test those classic gems on the opposite sex - in the wine bar, the supermarket, the launderette, the fitness club, at the night club or even at the beach - smooth in there to win the game.

You'll have everything going for you if you've got the right posing stuff but beware those put downs, you may never be the same again !

Check out your compatibility, learn a few fancy lines & find out just who is the sweetest talker in town ..... !

Contents

1 x playing board

1 x Pack of Chat-up lines & Decision cards

1 x Pack of Posing stuff, Responses & Compatibility check cards

6 x Pawns

1 x Die

30 x Counters (five of six colours)

1 x Rules Leaflet

32226.name: Liebe & Intrige
32226.description:
Each player represents a family trying to marry their three daughters. The daughters have three characteristics: Reputation, beauty, and education, all of which may increase and decrease in value during the course of the game. There are 14 gentlemen in the game, each of them demanding a minimum value in each characteristic. A daughter gets married immediately when she has collected three cards of the same gentleman, and meets the gentleman's standards in each of the three characteristics.

The game ends when a family marries all of their daughters. Points are scored from husbands, action cards, and also from majorities in each characteristic.

The game board depicts different parts of a town, each of them with a different number of available gentlemen cards.

A player's turn consists of:
1. Moving to a different region of the town.
2. Doing a region-specific action, or trying to scheme against another daughter in the same region.
3. Drawing an action card.

Region-specific actions usually mean choosing a gentleman card from those available, but sometimes also cause changes in a daughter's characteristics. Scheming against another daughter means trying to steal a gentleman card from them, by rolling a die. Action cards can be played anytime during a player's turn, and sometimes also as a reaction to cards played by other players.

32227.name: Nightmare Before Christmas Party Game
32227.description:
The Nightmare Before Christmas Party Game allows 2 - 4 teams to experience all the excitement of Jack Skellington's Halloweentown. At each location, the teams try to perform fun activities in order to earn Challenge Cards. The first team to score 12 Challenge Cards wins the game!

Game contents:

Game Board
Timer
Pads & Pencils
Tokens
Score Boards
Character, Challenge & Trivia Cards

32228.name: Snipkick
32228.description: A table top version of soccer. Finding a copy intact would be an accomplishment, as not even the the Spears history has a decent picture of it. One reason children's games are so collectible is that they are rarely found in good condition.

32229.name: Playing for the Cup
32229.description: This abstraction of a soccer game has players manipulating a ball counter across a board using dice rolls. The game includes 6 chits representing players on the field that may block the ball. Also included is a dual wheel for keeping score.

32230.name: On the Dirt Track
32230.description: One of Spears' many roll-and-move children's race games. In this one the players are motorcyclists in a dirt track race. The pawns are motorcycles.

32231.name: Wings of Fire
32231.description:
"Wings of Fire is a simple, simultaneous movement rules set that will allow you to recreate almost any WWII era air combat that actually occurred or even could have! Easy to learn, the rules are written so that once the game has been played once or twice, little leafing through them will be needed. Interaction among the players is stressed, with everyone participating. Including stats for 198 different aircraft models. So strap on your Mae West, grab your flying goggles, and scramble to play the game!"

2 teams of 2 or more players construct an air combat engagement using PBVs from the 198 different aircraft stats provided for miniatures. Players simultaneously plot movement and altitude within the performance parameters of the aircraft and take alternating turns executing the movement plot ( braking as needed) then followed by firing.

32232.description:
From the publisher:

Players move around the game board, decorating Charlie Brown's tree--which really lights up--giving gifts and collecting candy canes. The first player to make it back to the Season's Greetings area lights up the tree and wins!

Includes game board, playing pieces, spinner, game cards and instructions. 2-4 players. Ages 5 and up. Tree includes 2 replaceable button batteries.

There were two editions of this game. One had figurines of the characters; the other had cardboard markers in stands.
32232.name: A Charlie Brown Christmas

32234.description:
From "The Object of the Game":
To control the seas as much as possible during the period of the war. The winner is the player with the most "Points of Control" after 8 turns.

The game represents surface action between capital ships in WWII.

The mapboard is an abstract rendering of Europe/Eastern USA/Brazil and surrounding sea zones, divided into large movement zones. Individual counters represent single capital ships, U-boats, convoys and airstikes. Capital ship fire is simulated with dice rolls directed from and to individual ships, with damage being accrued and marked with counters until the target ship is sunk.

117 counters
32234.name: The War At Sea (first edition)

32235.name: Zombie Apocalypse
32235.description:
"Everybody said you were crazy, but you knew it was only a matter of time... and you were right.

Now they've risen, cold and hungry from the grave. Time to break out the shotguns and crowbars, and start laying the smackdown on some walking dead chumps!

'Zombie Apocalypse' is a miniatures game based on a stripped-down version of the "Action Dice" system. Included in the 22-page rulebook are simple rules for playing out your zombie infestation, 120 Gear Cards, and 70 Zombie Tokens.

Survival is no game, especially on the mean streets of the near future."

32236.description:
Grzybobranie - "The Mushrooming" - is a very old children roll and move game (it was old in early 1970-s...).

Players roll a single die and move their mug-shaped pawns along the road. When they stop on a space with one or more uncollected mushrooms (wooden or plastic pieces usually) they put them into their mugs. Red mushrooms are "bad", other ones are "good". Some spaces are event ones - like gain/lose a turn, go forward or backward, discard one or more mushrooms etc. When all the players reach the end of the track the one with most "good" mushrooms wins.

The game is very popular in Poland - there are many versions by many publishers (they often differ in the shape of the path, the number of mushrooms to collect, and the adventures included).
32236.name: Grzybobranie

32237.name: Hiiret juustojahdissa
32237.description: Each player has his own mouse. The idea of the game is to use this mouse and try to push as many pieces of cheese as possible to your own hole. Cheesepieces with worms do not score any points in the end.

32238.name: Popppunktur
32238.description:
An Icelandic (language dependent) trivia game about music. Based on a popular tv show and loosely based on another trivia game from 2001 called Gettu Betur.

There are 3550 questions and you move on the game board by answering questions correctly.

32239.description:
Spark is an Icelandic (language dependent) trivia game focused on football (soccer). The six categories of questions are about (1) modern Icelandic football, (2) history of Icelandic football, (3) national competition, (4) English football, (5) world clubs and (6) football players.

This game is (by the publisher) intended to be for players 8 to 108 years old. 4150 questions in all, on 1000 cards.
32239.name: Spark

32240.name: Gettu betur: barna og unglingaspilið
32240.description:
An Icelandic trivia game based on one of Icelands most popular tv show, the Gettu Betur trivia show where students representing their secondary schools compete for the Golden Microphone.

There are 2250 questions (language depentent) in this version of the board game which is aimed at children and teenagers.

32241.description:
Draumaeyjan (The Dream Island), subtitled A self-help game for an excited nation, is a game where the player decides what kind of industry he wants to build in Iceland, be it heavy industry, knowledge-based industry, tourist industry or agricultural/fishery.

Industries are paid for by resources gained from already built industries (much like in Catan) and monuments can be built after the players have built the pre-required industries. Various cards can be bought or are handed out according to the roll of the dice. These cards can then be used to further ones game or against other players.
32241.name: Draumaeyjan

32242.name: Witches and Liches
32242.description:
From the publisher's description:

In the heart of a dark dungeon the Lich waits, pacing the floor around its treasure. Just outside the chamber door the Witch takes a deep breath of the stale air. This is the climax of the story, the last battle.

The Wicked might triumph, retrieving the Elixir needed to control the moon. The Dead might triumph, collecting the final soul needed to break his chains.

An 8-page 5.5" x 8.5" booklet. You need dice and coins, as well as the map on the back of the booklet, to play.

32243.name: Latador
32243.description:
Latador is a game designed by Magnús Scheving, based on his play Latibær (which later became a cartoon show called Lazytown.) In Latador the player rolls a die and goes along the track and he has to follow the instructions on each step he lands on, healthy lifestyle and dexterity helps you win the game.

The name Latador is a homage to the Icelandic version of Monopoly which is called Matador. Along the way you can earn money, get few types of cards which can help you or others where you have to move or tell the thruth about your lifestyle.

32244.name: The Game of Ship's Cargo
32244.description:
This is an interesting 19th Century card game in which players take turns offering one of their goods for auction.
